original: yu budzha zhes pas aa ka ru bsgyur ro //
analyzed: yu budzha zhes pas aa ka ru bsgyur ro //

analyzed: busha dang ghi ni na dag la zhes pas lnga pa dbyi'o //

analyzed: sha ta rjes su 'brel pa las a'i'o zhes pas a'i yig go// @274a * // g'a las tha ka'o //

original: kee gee sgra la'o zhes pa 'di las bzo bo'i don la tha ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kee gee sgra la'o zhes pa 'di las bzo bo'i don la tha ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: klu dbyangs bzo bar byed pa can ni /
analyzed: klu dbyangs bzo bar byed pa can ni /

original: g'a t'a / tritsa'o //
analyzed: g'a t'a / tritsa'o //

original: nyu ta yang ngo //
analyzed: nyu ta yang ngo //
translated: The word nuta also changes it to the case ending for the locative.

original: ga ya ti las bzo bo'i den la nyu ta'i rkyon 'gyur ro //🔽g'a yan:/ nyuta'o //🔽yu bu dzha zhes pas aa nar bsgyur ro //
analyzed: ga ya ti las bzo bo'i den la nyu ta'i rkyon 'gyur ro // g'a yan:/ nyuta'o // yu bu dzha zhes pas aa nar bsgyur ro //

original: aa mtha' rnams kyi aitsa la a'a yi zhes pas a'a yi'o //
analyzed: aa mtha' rnams kyi aitsa la a'a yi zhes pas a'a yi'o //

original: sbyor ba brtsams pa ni phyi ma'i don no /🔽h'a las dus dang 'bru dag la'o //🔽ha zhes pa ao h'a ka gtong ba la'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba brtsams pa ni phyi ma'i don no / h'a las dus dang 'bru dag la'o // ha zhes pa ao h'a ka gtong ba la'o //

original: a'ang 'gro ba la'o zhes pa yang na'o //
analyzed: a'ang 'gro ba la'o zhes pa yang na'o //
translated: The word ha changes it to the case ending for the ablative.🔽The word a changes it to the case ending for the locative.

analyzed: ha'i byings las dus dang 'bru'i don la'ang nyuta pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dor bar byed do zhes pa /

analyzed: chu 'dor bar byed zhes pa ni /

original: dus dang 'bru dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /

translated: What is the meaning of “time and grain”?🔽It is

analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa gcig bzung bas 'brel pa can gnyis so zhes pa'i tshig las so //

analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la byings 'di rnams las na'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chos 'dod par byed do //

original: k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: k'a ri ta dbyi'o //

translated: In the case of the beginning of an action, the suffix -in is not added to a feminine noun. The meaning is “one who is not.” This is from the rule aṅaṅgāyai ka. The suffix -in is added to the root. Here it is not changed.

original: m'am sa sh'i la /
analyzed: m'am sa sh'i la /

analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la a'i kshi dang ksha mi dag las na bshad par bya ste /

original: su kha pra ti'i ksh'a /
analyzed: su kha pra ti'i ksh'a /

analyzed: ba hu ksha m'a /

original: bde ba so sor mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba so sor mthong ngo //

original: mang du bzod do zhes la na'o //
analyzed: mang du bzod do zhes la na'o //

analyzed: bud med la aa las a'ap\'o // nyer bsgyur med pa'i aata las da'o //

analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la nyer bsgyur med pa'i a'ata la te a'a yig mtha' can gyi byings las da'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //

original: las la aana'o zhes pas aana thob pa la'o //🔽go da:/ kamba la da:/🔽ba lang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: las la aana'o zhes pas aana thob pa la'o // go da:/ kamba la da:/ ba lang sbyin par byed do //
translated: The suffix -in is added to the root to do (kr) in the sense of to do for oneself.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to give (da) in the sense of to give to others.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to give (da) in the sense of to give to oneself.

original: kamba la sbyin par byed do zhes la da'o //
analyzed: kamba la sbyin par byed do zhes la da'o //
translated: The suffix -in is added to the root to give (da) in the sense of to give to others.

analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa zhes pa ci zhe na / ba da p'a sanda ya:/

analyzed: rgod ma yang dag par sbyin no zhes pa las aa ma na'o //

original: ming la sth'a las kyang ngo //🔽da zhes pa kho na'o //🔽ming nye ba'i tshig la tishtha ti las da'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming la sth'a las kyang ngo // da zhes pa kho na'o // ming nye ba'i tshig la tishtha ti las da'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of name.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of only.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of name.

original: mnyam du gnas par byed do zhes pa la /
analyzed: mnyam du gnas par byed do zhes pa la /
translated: The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of to stand together.

original: sa mastha:/ de bzhin du /🔽bi sha mastha:/ ya trastha:/
analyzed: sa mastha:/ de bzhin du /🔽bi sha mastha:/ ya trastha:/
translated: Similarly,🔽the suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of to stand in the same place.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of to stand in a place.🔽 The suffix -in is added to the root to stand (sthā) in the sense of to stand in a place.

original: ta trastha:/ thams cad las a'a yig gi mtha' can ming nye ba'i tshig can las da'i rkyen 'ga' zhig tu 'dod de /
analyzed: ta trastha:/ thams cad las a'a yig gi mtha' can ming nye ba'i tshig can las da'i rkyen 'ga' zhig tu 'dod de /
translated: From all words ending in the syllable a and having a proximate word, the suffix da is desired in some cases.

analyzed: de la rus sbal gyis 'thung bar byed do la /
translated: There, turtle drinks.🔽With the two, drinking is

analyzed: dvi pa:/ rkang pas 'thung bar byed pa ni //

analyzed: p'a da pa:/ tunda sho ka dag la pa ri mri dza aap nud dag gi'o //

analyzed: tunda dang sho ka dag rim bzhin nye ba'i tshi pa ri sngon ma'i mri dzu dag pa /

original: aapa sngon @275a * //
analyzed: aapa sngon @275a * //

analyzed: ma'inud ded pa la da'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tunda pa ri mri dza:/

analyzed: sho k'a pa nu da:/ gdung ba yongs su dag par byed do //

analyzed: mya ngan sel bar byed do la da'o //

original: bra la d'a dang dznya las so //
analyzed: bra la d'a dang dznya las so //

analyzed: las la zhes pa kho na'o //

analyzed: pra p'a pra da:/ pa thi pra dznya:/

analyzed: chu khang rab tu sbyin par byed do //

analyzed: lam rnams rab tu rtogs par byed do la da'o //

analyzed: gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi zhes pas panthi'i sgra'i na dbyi'o //

analyzed: pra s'a samd'a ya:/

analyzed: go sam khya:/ tsa kshing khyanya tu bsgyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du /

original: aa shv'a sam khya:/

analyzed: ga las taka'o //

original: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa kho na'o //

original: s'a ma ga:/ s'a ma g'i /
analyzed: s'a ma ga:/ s'a ma g'i /

analyzed: de bzhin du //

original: mardyu ra ga:/ ma du ra g'i /

analyzed: su ra sh'i dhu dag la po ba ti las so //

analyzed: su r'a dang sh'i dhu dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la nyer bsgur med pa las pi ba ti las da ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chang 'thung bar byed do zhes la / su r'a p'i /

analyzed: su r'a pa:/ shidhu pa:/ su ra sh'i dhu dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: ksh'i ra p'a /

original: bud med do //
analyzed: bud med do //

original: nyer bsgyur med pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: su r'a pra ba ya:/
analyzed: su r'a pra ba ya:/

analyzed: aana'o // hri nya las pa yas dang gyen du 'dren pa min pa dag la aatsa'o //

analyzed: aam ga ha ra:/ ri ksha ha ra:/ pa ya sa la /
translated: The root a-ñj is used in the sense of throwing upward, as in a-ñja-ta, “armor,” and in the sense of not throwing upward, as in a-ñj-la, “to enter.”

original: aasthi ha ra:/ khyi'o//
analyzed: aasthi ha ra:/ khyi'o//
translated: The root a-ñj is used in the sense of throwing upward, as in a-ñja-ta, “armor,” and in the sense of not throwing upward, as in a-ñj-la, “to enter.”🔽The root a-ñj is used in the sense of throwing upward, as in a-ñja-ta, “armor,” and in the sense of not throwing upward, as in a-ñj-la, “to enter.”

original: ka ba tsa ha ra:/🔽rgyal rigs gzhon nu'o //🔽gyen du 'dren pa la ni bh'a ra har aana'o /
analyzed: ka ba tsa ha ra:/ rgyal rigs gzhon nu'o // gyen du 'dren pa la ni bh'a ra har aana'o /

translated: The root a-ñj is used in the sense of throwing upward, as in a-ñja-ta, “armor,” and in the sense of not throwing

original: las nye ba'i tshig la a'ang las pha rol gyi hri nya las de'i ngang tshul rtogs par bya bzhin pa na aa tsa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la a'ang las pha rol gyi hri nya las de'i ngang tshul rtogs par bya bzhin pa na aa tsa 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix -tva is added to the root ar, meaning “to go,” and the suffix -tva is added to the root hr, meaning “to understand.”

original: 'bras bu la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ni de'i ngang tshul lo //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos pa med par 'jug pa ni de'i ngang tshul lo //
translated: The state of that is the state of going and the state of understanding.

original: me tog rnams zas su za bar byed do zhes la /
analyzed: me tog rnams zas su za bar byed do zhes la /
translated: “They eat flowers for food.”

original: sushs'a har:/ de'i ngang tshul zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sushs'a har:/ de'i ngang tshul zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the state of that?

original: khur zas su za bar byed do zhes la /🔽bh'a ra h'a ra:/🔽aana'o // aa dha las kyang ngo //
analyzed: khur zas su za bar byed do zhes la / bh'a ra h'a ra:/ aana'o // aa dha las kyang ngo //
translated: “They eat the burden for food.”🔽The suffix -tva is added to the root hr, meaning “to understand.”🔽The suffix -tva is added to the root ar, meaning “to go.”

original: a'ang las de'i ngang tshul la'o zhes pa mi'jug go las nye ba'i tshig la aarta ti las aa tsa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'ang las de'i ngang tshul la'o zhes pa mi'jug go las nye ba'i tshig la aarta ti las aa tsa 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix -tva is added to the root hr, meaning “to understand.”

original: mchod par 'os so zhes la /
analyzed: mchod par 'os so zhes la /
translated: “He is worthy of worship.”

original: pu dz'a dh'a /🔽aana'i grub pa la sbyor ba brtams pa ni bud med la khyad par gyi don du ste /
analyzed: pu dz'a dh'a / aana'i grub pa la sbyor ba brtams pa ni bud med la khyad par gyi don du ste /
translated: The suffix -tva is added to the root pūj, meaning “to worship.”🔽The suffix -tva is added to the root stambha, meaning “to make stiff,” and the suffix -tva is added to the root karna, meaning “to make deaf.”

original: stambha dang karna dag nye ba'i tshig la rim pa ji lta bar rim dang dza pi dag las aatsa 'dod de /
analyzed: stambha dang karna dag nye ba'i tshig la rim pa ji lta bar rim dang dza pi dag las aatsa 'dod de /
translated: The suffix -tva is added to the root stambha, meaning “to make stiff,” and the suffix -tva is added to the root karna, meaning “to make deaf.”

original: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du lag lhan dang rtse mo dag gi don la'o //
analyzed: grangs ji lta ba bzhin du lag lhan dang rtse mo dag gi don la'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as the number of the words.

original: sngon po la dga' bar byed do zhes /🔽sta mbhe ra ma:/🔽rna ba zlas par byed do zhes /
analyzed: sngon po la dga' bar byed do zhes / sta mbhe ra ma:/ rna ba zlas par byed do zhes /
translated: He delights in the blue.🔽He makes the ear hear.

original: karna dza pa:/ aatsa'o //🔽dhrinya las mtshon cha la'ang danta dang su tra dag ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: karna dza pa:/ aatsa'o // dhrinya las mtshon cha la'ang danta dang su tra dag ma yin pa la'o //
translated: He makes the weapon.🔽From the root dhrin, to hold, the word dhanta is formed, and from the root sutra, to cut, the word sutra is formed.

original: mtshon bya'i las nye ba'i tshig la danta dang su tra bor ba na dhrinya bha ba la'o zhes pa 'di las aatsa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshon bya'i las nye ba'i tshig la danta dang su tra bor ba na dhrinya bha ba la'o zhes pa 'di las aatsa 'gyur ro //
translated: But from the root dhrin, to hold, the word dhrin is formed, and from the root sutra, to cut, the word sutra is formed.

original: rdo rje 'dzin du 'jug par byed do zhes la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin du 'jug par byed do zhes la /
translated: He makes the vajra holder.

original: badzra dha ra:/ de bzhin du /
analyzed: badzra dha ra:/ de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, from the root cakra, to hold, the word cakra is formed.🔽The meaning of the word ini is the thing to be applied and the thing that applies.

original: tsakra dhara:/ aina'i don ni rab tu sbyar bya dang / rab tu sbyor ba po'i dngos po ste nang gi bsgom par bya ba 'ba' zhig las kyang dhrinya'i 'dzin du 'jug go zhes ngag bya ba ste rnam pa gzhan du na ni don rnams su 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsakra dhara:/ aina'i don ni rab tu sbyar bya dang / rab tu sbyor ba po'i dngos po ste nang gi bsgom par bya ba 'ba' zhig las kyang dhrinya'i 'dzin du 'jug go zhes ngag bya ba ste rnam pa gzhan du na ni don rnams su 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the inner meditation alone, dhrin is formed, to hold. Otherwise, the meaning would be different.

original: slar yang 'dir rab tu sbyar bya dang rab tu sbyor ba bo zhes pa dag ci zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang 'dir rab tu sbyar bya dang rab tu sbyor ba bo zhes pa dag ci zhe na /
translated: Again, here what is the object of application and the one who applies?

original: smras pa rdo rje ni gzung bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa rdo rje ni gzung bya ste /
translated: It is said: the vajra is the object of application.

original: rang gi ngo bo nges par gnas pa dang de nges par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges par gnas pa dang de nges par gnas pa'o //
translated: Its own nature is ascertained and that is ascertained.

original: nges par gnas pa de gang sbyor bar byed pa de ni sbyor ba po ste rdo rje ni rab tu sbyar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par gnas pa de gang sbyor bar byed pa de ni sbyor ba po ste rdo rje ni rab tu sbyar bya'o //
translated: That which is ascertained is applied, and that is the one who applies. The vajra is the object of application.

original: danta dang su tra dag ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: danta dang su tra dag ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of not in danta and sutra?

original: danta dh'a ra:/ sutra dha ra:/
analyzed: danta dh'a ra:/ sutra dha ra:/
translated: Danta-dharaḥ, sutra-dharaḥ.

original: sutra'i @276a * //
analyzed: sutra'i @276a * //
translated: Sutra is not a weapon.

original: mtshon cha min pa bkag pa'i shes par byed pa las kha cig tu mtshon cha ma yin pa la yang aatsa 'gyur te /🔽des na / dza t'a dha ra:/
analyzed: mtshon cha min pa bkag pa'i shes par byed pa las kha cig tu mtshon cha ma yin pa la yang aatsa 'gyur te / des na / dza t'a dha ra:/
translated: From the understanding that excludes non-weapons, in some cases ac also becomes a weapon.

original: bhu dha ra:/ zhes pa la sogs pa grub po //
analyzed: bhu dha ra:/ zhes pa la sogs pa grub po //
translated: Therefore, jatā-dharaḥ, bhujaṅga-dharaḥ, and so on are established.

original: dha nus dantatba tu lam gang la am ku sha yashti shakti to mar rnams la gra hi las yang na'o //
analyzed: dha nus dantatba tu lam gang la am ku sha yashti shakti to mar rnams la gra hi las yang na'o //
translated: From dhanu, in the sense of danta-tva-laṃ-ghana, on which am-kuśa-yaṣṭi-śakti-tomaras exist, there is agraha.

original: dha nus dang danta dang tpa tu dang lam gal dang am ku sha dang yashti dang shakti dang to mar zhes pa 'di rnams kyi las kyi nye ba'i tshig la gra hi las aatsa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dha nus dang danta dang tpa tu dang lam gal dang am ku sha dang yashti dang shakti dang to mar zhes pa 'di rnams kyi las kyi nye ba'i tshig la gra hi las aatsa 'gyur ro //
translated: The words dhanuḥ, danta, taptu, laṅgala, aṅkuśa, yaṣṭi, śakti, and toma have the near-synonym aṭ in the sense of action.

original: yang na'i sgra ni sdud pa la'o //
analyzed: yang na'i sgra ni sdud pa la'o //
translated: Moreover, the word api is for the purpose of including.

original: gzhu 'dzin par byed do zhes dha nu rgraha:/
analyzed: gzhu 'dzin par byed do zhes dha nu rgraha:/
translated: He takes up the bow, dhanur gṛhṇāti.

original: de bzhin du /🔽danta gra ha:/ tpa tu graha:/
analyzed: de bzhin du / danta gra ha:/ tpa tu graha:/
translated: Similarly,🔽dantagrāha,🔽taptugrāha,

original: l'am ga la gra ha:/
analyzed: l'am ga la gra ha:/
translated: laṅgalagrāha,

original: am ku shagra ha:/
analyzed: am ku shagra ha:/
translated: aṅkuśagrāha,

original: yashti graha: sha kti graha:/
analyzed: yashti graha: sha kti graha:/
translated: yaṣṭigrāha, śaktigrāha,

original: to ma ra graha:/
analyzed: to ma ra graha:/
translated: and tomaragrāha.

original: 'dis aa ts'o gha t'i dang ghata las kyang aatsa 'dod de /🔽gha t'i gra ha:/
analyzed: 'dis aa ts'o gha t'i dang ghata las kyang aatsa 'dod de / gha t'i gra ha:/
translated: By this, aṭ is also desired from ghaṭī and ghaṭa.🔽Ghaṭīgrāha,

original: gha ta gra ha:/
analyzed: gha ta gra ha:/
translated: ghaṭagrāha.

original: stamba karna dag la ra mi dza pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: stamba karna dag la ra mi dza pa dag gi'o //
translated: For stambha and karṇa, there are rimijapa.

original: stamba dang karna dag gis nye ba'i tshig la ri mi dang dza pi dag las grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: stamba dang karna dag gis nye ba'i tshig la ri mi dang dza pi dag las grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Stambha and karṇa have the near-synonyms rimi and japa respectively, in the sense of aṭ.

original: lag ldan dang skyo ma'i don dag la aatsa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag ldan dang skyo ma'i don dag la aatsa 'gyur ro //
translated: They have the meanings of “having arms” and “discouragement.”

original: stamper ma:/ sdong po la dga' byed do //
analyzed: stamper ma:/ sdong po la dga' byed do //
translated: He delights in the trunk.🔽KARNAJASA.

original: karne dza sa:/ rna bar zlos par byed do la aatsa'o //
analyzed: karne dza sa:/ rna bar zlos par byed do la aatsa'o //

original: sham snga ma rnams las ming la'o //
analyzed: sham snga ma rnams las ming la'o //
translated: The last syllable is in the name.

original: byings gang rnams las snga mar sham gyi sgra yod pa de rnams ni sham snga ma can rnams so //
analyzed: byings gang rnams las snga mar sham gyi sgra yod pa de rnams ni sham snga ma can rnams so //
translated: Those roots which have the syllable SHAM at the end are those which have the last syllable SHAM.

original: sham gyi sgra snga ma can gyi byings gang yin pa de rnams las ming gi yul la aats'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sham gyi sgra snga ma can gyi byings gang yin pa de rnams las ming gi yul la aats'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From those roots which have the syllable SHAM at the end, the affix ACHA is formed in the feminine.

original: bde bar byed do zhes shangka ra:/
analyzed: bde bar byed do zhes shangka ra:/
translated: He makes happy. SHAMKARA.🔽He is the source of happiness.🔽SHAMBHAVA.

original: bde 'byung zhes /
analyzed: bde 'byung zhes /
translated: He enjoys happiness.

original: shambha ba:/ bde spyod ces /
analyzed: shambha ba:/ bde spyod ces /
translated: SHAMBHADA.

original: sham ba da:/ bde mchog ces /
analyzed: sham ba da:/ bde mchog ces /
translated: He is the supreme happiness.🔽SHAMBHARA.

original: sham ba ra:/ 'dis aatsa'o //
analyzed: sham ba ra:/ 'dis aatsa'o //
translated: This is ACHA.

original: sham la ming la'o zhes bya ba la snga ma smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: sham la ming la'o zhes bya ba la snga ma smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don no //
translated: SHAM is in the name means that the word last has various meanings.

original: gzhi la'ang sh'ing las so //
analyzed: gzhi la'ang sh'ing las so //
translated: It is also in the basis from SHING.

original: gzhi la nye ba'i tshig la shing las aatsa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi la nye ba'i tshig la shing las aatsa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: In the basis, in the near word, from SHING the affix ACHA is formed.

original: mkha' la nyal lo //
analyzed: mkha' la nyal lo //
translated: He sleeps in the sky.🔽KASHAYA.

original: kha sha ya:/ de bzhin du /
analyzed: kha sha ya:/ de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: bi le sha ya:/
analyzed: bi le sha ya:/
translated: VILESHAYA.

original: byed pa la p'arsha la sogs pa rnams nye ba'i tshig la aatsa 'dod de /
analyzed: byed pa la p'arsha la sogs pa rnams nye ba'i tshig la aatsa 'dod de /
translated: In the case of the causative, the Pārśva and so forth assert the affix aṇ.

original: p'arsha rnams las nyal lo //
analyzed: p'arsha rnams las nyal lo //
translated: They sleep from the Pārśva.🔽Pārśvaśayate.

original: p'arsh'a sha ya:/ autt'a na sogs rnams la byed pa po la'o //
analyzed: p'arsh'a sha ya:/ autt'a na sogs rnams la byed pa po la'o //
translated: In the case of the uṇ affix and so forth, it is for the agent.

original: autt'a na nyal bar byed do //🔽autt'a na sha ya:/
analyzed: autt'a na nyal bar byed do // autt'a na sha ya:/
translated: The uṇ affix sleeps.🔽Uṇśayate.🔽The aṇ affix sleeps.

original: aa ba s'u tsa sha ya:/
analyzed: aa ba s'u tsa sha ya:/
translated: Aṇśayate.

original: tsa ri las ta'o //
analyzed: tsa ri las ta'o //
translated: The affix ta is from cari.

original: gzhi la nye ba'i tshig la tsa ri las t'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi la nye ba'i tshig la tsa ri las t'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the proximate word, the ta affix is from cari.

original: ku ru rnams su rgyu bar byed do ku ru tsa ra:/
analyzed: ku ru rnams su rgyu bar byed do ku ru tsa ra:/
translated: He moves in the Kuru region. Kuru-cāri.

original: rkyen gzhan byed pa ni bud med la a'i yig gi don te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan byed pa ni bud med la a'i yig gi don te /
translated: The other affix is the meaning of the letter i for a woman.

original: ku ru tsa r'i:/
analyzed: ku ru tsa r'i:/

original: kshe ma ka ra:/🔽pri yam ka ra:/🔽ma dram ka ra:/
analyzed: kshe ma ka ra:/ pri yam ka ra:/ ma dram ka ra:/
translated: kṣemaṃ kṛt🔽priyaṃ kṛt

original: bha dri ka ra:/
analyzed: bha dri ka ra:/
translated: dravyaṃ kṛt

original: phyogs gcig la /🔽kshe mam ka ra:/
analyzed: phyogs gcig la / kshe mam ka ra:/
translated: In one case,🔽kṣemaṃ kāraḥ,

original: pri yam k'a ra:/🔽ma dram k'a ra:/
analyzed: pri yam k'a ra:/ ma dram k'a ra:/
translated: priyaṃ kāraḥ,🔽madaṃ kāraḥ,

original: bha dram k'a ra:/
analyzed: bha dram k'a ra:/
translated: bhadraṃ kāraḥ,🔽anaḥ.

original: aana'o // ci ste yang na gzung pa ma byas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: aana'o // ci ste yang na gzung pa ma byas pa ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gang gi phyir kha'i rkyen la rnam par brtag pa spyir thob par 'gyur ba kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kha'i rkyen la rnam par brtag pa spyir thob par 'gyur ba kho na ma yin te /
translated: Because the condition of the mouth is not generally obtained by analysis.

original: 'dir aan smos pa la yod pa min pa'i ting nge 'dzin aan 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar rgyu dang de'i dang tshul dang rjes su mthun par brjod par 'dod pa krinya las rgyu la'o zhes pas ta'i rkyen yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir aan smos pa la yod pa min pa'i ting nge 'dzin aan 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar rgyu dang de'i dang tshul dang rjes su mthun par brjod par 'dod pa krinya las rgyu la'o zhes pas ta'i rkyen yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, as in the case of the concentration called “unwavering,” it is not in the ana-statement. As it is, the desired expression of conformity with the cause and its manner is kṛtyā, from which the condition of the ta is also obtained.

original: sa m'a bhuta ces pa 'dis phyogs gcig la'ang ji lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa m'a bhuta ces pa 'dis phyogs gcig la'ang ji lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this samābhūta, it is as in one case.

original: de'i don la aa na smos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don la aa na smos pa'o //
translated: Its meaning is in the ana-statement.

original: dngos po dang byed pa dag la a'a shi ta la bh'u las so ;
analyzed: dngos po dang byed pa dag la a'a shi ta la bh'u las so ;
translated: In the case of things and actions, it is from āśita and bhū.

original: / a'a shi ta'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la bh'u las dngos po dang byed pa'i don la'ang kha'i rkyen 'gyur ro //🔽a'a shi ta'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: / a'a shi ta'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la bh'u las dngos po dang byed pa'i don la'ang kha'i rkyen 'gyur ro // a'a shi ta'i dngos po ni /
translated: The word āśīta is a derivative, and the suffix khya is added to the meaning of a thing and an action.🔽The thing āśīta is:

original: a'a shi tam bha bam /
analyzed: a'a shi tam bha bam /
translated: āśītaṃ bhavaṃ

original: 'dis a'a shi tam byed do //
analyzed: 'dis a'a shi tam byed do //

original: a'a shi tam bha bam /
analyzed: a'a shi tam bha bam /
translated: āśītaṃ bhavaṃ

analyzed: 'dis kha'o // ming la tri bhri bri dzi dh'a ri ta bi da mi sa ha rnams kyi ming la'o //

analyzed: tri rkyal pa la'o //

analyzed: tu bhram nya 'dzin pa la'o//

analyzed: dzi rgyal ba la'o //

analyzed: da mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //

analyzed: shaha bzod pa la'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi byings rnams las ming nye ba'i tshig la ming gi yul la kha'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From these roots, the suffix khya is added to the meaning of a name in the object of a name.

analyzed: ra tham ta ra:/

original: bi shvam bha ra:/
analyzed: bi shvam bha ra:/

analyzed: pa tim bar:/ dha @279a * //

analyzed: nanydzaya:/ yu gam dha ra:/

analyzed: ming zhes pa rjes su 'jug bzhin pa na slar yang ming la zhes pa 'di rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //

analyzed: kro sha ha:/ slar yang las smos pa ni go sla ba'i don du'o //

original: kle sha ta mas dag la aa pa las so //
analyzed: kle sha ta mas dag la aa pa las so //
translated: The repetition of the word “action” is for the sake of an easy meaning.🔽From kleśa and tama, the near-synonyms, the particle apa is elided.

original: kle sha @279b dang ta mas dag las nye ba'i tshig dag la aa pa las pha rol gyi hanti gang yin pa de las ta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kle sha @279b dang ta mas dag las nye ba'i tshig dag la aa pa las pha rol gyi hanti gang yin pa de las ta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From kleśa and tama, the near-synonyms, the particle apa is elided, and the suffix tai is added to the far-removed hanti.

original: kle sha sa ha:/
analyzed: kle sha sa ha:/

original: ta mo sa ha:/
analyzed: ta mo sa ha:/
translated: tamaḥ-sahāḥ.

original: nyon mongs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sel bar byed do //

original: mun pa sel bar byed do zhes la da'o //
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed do zhes la da'o //

original: 'o na bi sh'a sa ha du: kh'as ha:/
analyzed: 'o na bi sh'a sa ha du: kh'as ha:/
translated: viśva-sahāḥ.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: gzhan las kyang ngo zhes pa 'dis 'dir da'i rkyen te /

analyzed: sbyor ba brtsams pa ni spros pa'i don du'o // ku m'a ra sh'i dag la ni ni'o //
translated: The composition of the compound is for the sake of elaboration.🔽In kumāra and śīta, the particle ni is [added].

original: ku m'a ra dang sh'i ca dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la ha nti las ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ku m'a ra dang sh'i ca dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la ha nti las ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From kumāra and śīta, the near-synonyms, the particle ni is added to hanti.

original: ku m'a ra gh'a t'i //
analyzed: ku m'a ra gh'a t'i //
translated: kumāra-ghāti.

original: sharsha gh'a ti /
analyzed: sharsha gh'a ti /
translated: śīta-ghāti.

original: ni ni'o // ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni ni'o // ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //

original: na yig ni ai tsa dang 'dra ba'i don to //
analyzed: na yig ni ai tsa dang 'dra ba'i don to //
translated: The letter na is like the i-vowel and the c-consonant.🔽The suffix ta is added to hanti.

original: hanti'i ta'o // hanti'i h'i ghi'o dz'a y'a pa ti dag la mtshon byed can la da ka'o //
analyzed: hanti'i ta'o // hanti'i h'i ghi'o dz'a y'a pa ti dag la mtshon byed can la da ka'o //
translated: The suffix ka is added to hanti, jaya, and pati, when they are the subject.

original: gang gi mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de ni mtshon byed can no //
analyzed: gang gi mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de ni mtshon byed can no //
translated: That which has a sign that indicates is the subject.

original: mantu sogs nyid las aa yig gi rkyen no //
analyzed: mantu sogs nyid las aa yig gi rkyen no //
translated: The letter a is added to mantr and so forth.

original: dz'a y'a dang pa ti dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la hanti las da k'i rkyen 'gyur te /
analyzed: dz'a y'a dang pa ti dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la hanti las da k'i rkyen 'gyur te /
translated: The suffix ka is added to jaya and pati, when they are the object of a verbal action, from hanti.

original: mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa bo'i don la'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa bo'i don la'o //
translated: The suffix ka is added to the verbal root, which has the meaning of the agent, that has the characteristic of that which is indicated.

original: dz'a yaghna:/ ku m'ar ghna:/
analyzed: dz'a yaghna:/ ku m'ar ghna:/
translated: jaya-ghnaḥ, kumāra-ghnaḥ,

original: pa ti ghna:/ ku m'a r'i //
analyzed: pa ti ghna:/ ku m'a r'i //

original: 'dis daka'o // gam han dzan zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis daka'o // gam han dzan zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //

original: au pa dh'a phyis pa'i yang ngo zhes pas gha'o //
analyzed: au pa dh'a phyis pa'i yang ngo zhes pas gha'o //

original: mi ma yin pa byed pa po 'ang ngo //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa byed pa po 'ang ngo //

analyzed: byings do gang gi byed pa po ma yin pa de ni mi byed pa po'o //

original: des na dgag ba'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: des na dgag ba'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the negation of the object.

original: las nye ba'i tshig la mi ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i byings kyi don la 'jug bzhin pa na hanti las daka 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la mi ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i byings kyi don la 'jug bzhin pa na hanti las daka 'gyur ro //

original: dza y'a ghnasti la ka:/
analyzed: dza y'a ghnasti la ka:/
translated: jaya ghanasthiti lakaḥ

analyzed: pa ti ghni re kh'a /

analyzed: shlesh+ya ghnam ma dhu:/

analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i byed pa'o zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: a'a khu gh'a to bri sha la:/

analyzed: las la aana'o //

original: 'o na / kritra ghna:/
analyzed: 'o na / kritra ghna:/

original: khal:/ ci zhe na /
analyzed: khal:/ ci zhe na /

analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: kri tya dang yuta dag gzhan la yang zhes pa'i tshig la ha ti ma gtogs grub pa'i byed pa po ming las na ga ra snga ma las hanti las taka bshad par bya'o //

original: des na / 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na / 'dir mi 'gyur te /

original: na ga ra gh'a ti ha sti /
analyzed: na ga ra gh'a ti ha sti /

analyzed: hasti ka p'a da dag la nus pa la'o //

analyzed: ha sti dang ka p'a da dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la 'jug bzhin pa'i hanti las dak 'gyur te /

analyzed: mi byed pa po'i don brjod pa'o //

analyzed: hasti ghno ma nu shya:/

analyzed: ka p'a da ghna:/

analyzed: nus pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: khyad par gyi glang po 'joms pa ni /

original: hasti gh'a ta:/ p'a ni gha tr'a da gha dag bzo bo la'o //
analyzed: hasti gh'a ta:/ p'a ni gha tr'a da gha dag bzo bo la'o //

analyzed: su dh'i b'a /

analyzed: legs par 'dzin par byed do zhes la kva ni pa'o //

original: da ma g'a ya ti zhes pas a'i nyi da do //
analyzed: da ma g'a ya ti zhes pas a'i nyi da do //

original: bhu ri da da b'a /
analyzed: bhu ri da da b'a /

analyzed: mang po ster bar byed do zhes la ba ni pa'o //

analyzed: s'i b'a / kva ni pa'o //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du a'i nyid do //

original: k'i l'a la p'a:/
analyzed: k'i l'a la p'a:/

analyzed: chu 'thung bar byed do zhes la bita'o //

original: kvi pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: kvi pa'ang ngo //

original: byings las kvi pa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings las kvi pa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: au kh'a pra ta:/
analyzed: au kh'a pra ta:/

original: pa rna dhva ta:/🔽rlung yab kyis ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: pa rna dhva ta:/ rlung yab kyis ltung bar byed do //

original: lo ma 'jig par byed do zhes kvipa'o //
analyzed: lo ma 'jig par byed do zhes kvipa'o //

original: aita rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa zhes pas na dbyi'o //
analyzed: aita rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa zhes pas na dbyi'o //

original: sra si dhva sa dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas da'o //
analyzed: sra si dhva sa dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas da'o //

original: ghri ta spri kra / mantra spri ka / mar la reg par byed do //
analyzed: ghri ta spri kra / mantra spri ka / mar la reg par byed do //
translated: Ghrita-sprika, mantra-sprika, he touches the butter.

original: sngags kyis reg par byed do zhes la @281b kvip\'o ;
analyzed: sngags kyis reg par byed do zhes la @281b kvip\'o ;
translated: He touches the mantra, thus the ka.

original: / tsa sde dang dri sha sogs rnams rnams kyi 'ang ngo zhes pas ga yig dang ka nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: / tsa sde dang dri sha sogs rnams rnams kyi 'ang ngo zhes pas ga yig dang ka nyid kyang ngo //
translated: And of the C-group, the Drishad, etc., and of the others, thus the ga and the ka.

original: ri tvi ka da dhrika praka dikra aushni ha rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: ri tvi ka da dhrika praka dikra aushni ha rnams kyang ngo //
translated: And the Ritvikas, Dadhrkas, Prakas, Dikkas, and Usnih-has.

original: ri tvi ka dang da dhrika dang prak dang dika dang aushni ha 'di rnams kyi sgra tshig phrad de /
analyzed: ri tvi ka dang da dhrika dang prak dang dika dang aushni ha 'di rnams kyi sgra tshig phrad de /
translated: The Ritvikas, Dadhrkas, Prakas, Dikkas, and Usnih-has, these are the terms of the compound.

original: ri tvi ka ri tu sngon ma'i yadza las mchod du 'gro bar bed do zhes kvip\'o //
analyzed: ri tvi ka ri tu sngon ma'i yadza las mchod du 'gro bar bed do zhes kvip\'o //
translated: The Ritvikas go to the sacrifice, thus the ka.

original: svapi ba tsi yadza sogs zhes pas sampra s'a ra na'o //
analyzed: svapi ba tsi yadza sogs zhes pas sampra s'a ra na'o //
translated: And the Samprasaras, from the svapa, vac, yaja, etc., thus the na.

original: sgra 'di tshig phrad de khyad par gyi yul la 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sgra 'di tshig phrad de khyad par gyi yul la 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is a compound word, for the purpose of entering into the special object.

original: da dhrika nyi dhrisha spyi brtol byed do zhes kvi pra'o //
analyzed: da dhrika nyi dhrisha spyi brtol byed do zhes kvi pra'o //
translated: The Dadhrkas are the priests, thus the ka.

original: gnyis brjod pa tshig phrad do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod pa tshig phrad do //
translated: The repetition of the two is a compound word.🔽 🔽The Prakas are the priests, thus the ka.

original: dri sha sogs nyid las ga'o //
analyzed: dri sha sogs nyid las ga'o //
translated: From dri and śa and so on, ga.

original: prak pridza 'dor ba la'o //
analyzed: prak pridza 'dor ba la'o //
translated: Prak prij is for abandoning.

original: 'dor bar bya'o zhes las kyi don la kvip\'o //
analyzed: 'dor bar bya'o zhes las kyi don la kvip\'o //
translated: Abandoning is for the meaning of the action, with kvip.

original: tshig phrad do //
analyzed: tshig phrad do //
translated: It is a verbal prefix.

original: aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The syllable a is for āgama.

original: dkra di sha shin tu 'dor ba la'o //
analyzed: dkra di sha shin tu 'dor ba la'o //
translated: Krak diśa is for abandoning completely.

original: shin tu 'dor bar bya'o zhes las kyi don la kvipra ste tshig phrad do //
analyzed: shin tu 'dor bar bya'o zhes las kyi don la kvipra ste tshig phrad do //
translated: Abandoning completely is for the meaning of the action, with kvip. It is a verbal prefix.

original: aushni ka / sniha dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: aushni ka / sniha dga' ba la'o //
translated: Uṣṇika; Sniha is for delighting.

original: auta sngon du'o //🔽shin tu dga' bar bya'o zhes kvip\'o //
analyzed: auta sngon du'o // shin tu dga' bar bya'o zhes kvip\'o //
translated: Uta is for before.🔽Delighting completely is for the meaning of the action, with kvip.

original: aut kyi ta phyis pa tshig phrad do //
analyzed: aut kyi ta phyis pa tshig phrad do //
translated: Uta kṛta is a verbal prefix.

original: tyad sogs la dpe la dri sha las las la taka sak dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: tyad sogs la dpe la dri sha las las la taka sak dag kyang ngo //
translated: In the examples of tyad and so on, from driśa for the action, tak and saka are also used.

original: las la zhes pa kho na'o //🔽las la dpe la /
analyzed: las la zhes pa kho na'o // las la dpe la /
translated: It is only for the action.

original: tyad sogs nye ba'i tshig la dri sha las /
analyzed: tyad sogs nye ba'i tshig la dri sha las /
translated: In the action, in the example, from driśa for the action, in the verbal prefix,

original: las kyi don la kvip 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi don la kvip 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes kvip.

original: tak dang sak dag kang ngo //🔽tya trik / ty'a dr'i sha / ty'a driksha:/
analyzed: tak dang sak dag kang ngo // tya trik / ty'a dr'i sha / ty'a driksha:/
translated: Tak and saka are also used.🔽Tyadrik, tyādreśa, tyādrikṣa,

original: t'a dri sha:/ t'a dri ksha:/
analyzed: t'a dri sha:/ t'a dri ksha:/
translated: tādṛśa, tādṛkṣa.

original: de lta bu'i dper bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dper bya'o //
translated: Such an example is to be made.

original: 'di lta bu'i dper bya'o zhes dri sha las kvi pa dang tak dang sa ka'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i dper bya'o zhes dri sha las kvi pa dang tak dang sa ka'o //

original: kvi pa pha rol la dri sha sogs nyid kyi phyir ga nyid do //🔽sak la tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
analyzed: kvi pa pha rol la dri sha sogs nyid kyi phyir ga nyid do // sak la tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
translated: Because of the very driśa etc. in the other, the kvi is added.🔽The sa is also added to the śa and sa.

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o //
translated: The ka is added to the śa and dha.

original: sarba n'a ma'i a'a'o zhes pas a'a nyid do //
analyzed: sarba n'a ma'i a'a'o zhes pas a'a nyid do //
translated: The ā is added because of sarvanāmāmi āḥ.

original: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: te ne ba dri shya te /
analyzed: te ne ba dri shya te /

original: dpe la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dpe la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: sa dri shya te /
analyzed: sa dri shya te /

analyzed: tyad sogs la zhes pa ci zhe na ; de ba ai ba dri shya te /

original: sa ai ba pa shyati /
analyzed: sa ai ba pa shyati /

analyzed: aan+ya'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la dri sha las kvipra dang tak dang sa ka bshad par bya ste /

original: gzhan lta bur mthong ba ni /

analyzed: ming las rigs ma yin pa la ni ni ste de'i ngang tshul la'o //

translated: It is in the case of the agent.

original: byed pa po nye ba'i tshig la byings las ni ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po nye ba'i tshig la byings las ni ni 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix ni is from the root kr, to do, in the case of the agent.

original: rigs kyi don dang de'i ngang tshul ma yin pa brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi don dang de'i ngang tshul ma yin pa brjod pa la'o //
translated: It is in the expression of the meaning of the class and its mode, which is not that.

original: rnga mo bzhin du du bar byed pa ni aushta kro sh'i /
analyzed: rnga mo bzhin du du bar byed pa ni aushta kro sh'i /
translated: The one who makes a sound like a camel is uṣṭakrośī.

original: kro shi las 'dis ni ni'o //
analyzed: kro shi las 'dis ni ni'o //
translated: The suffix ni is from the root kr, to do, in the case of the agent.

original: bya rog ltar sgrogs pa ni /🔽dhvamksha bi r'a b'i /
analyzed: bya rog ltar sgrogs pa ni / dhvamksha bi r'a b'i /
translated: The one who makes a sound like a crow is kākarakṣita.🔽 The suffix vi is from the root kṣa, to scratch, in the case of the agent.

original: ru sgra la'o //
analyzed: ru sgra la'o //
translated: The suffix ru is in the case of the agent.

original: byed pa po la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽aa pu p'a ni ba bhaksha ya ti ma sh'an /
analyzed: byed pa po la zhes pa ci zhe na / aa pu p'a ni ba bhaksha ya ti ma sh'an /
translated: What is meant by in the case of the agent?🔽 The one who eats like a dog is apupaṇibhakṣayati māṃsaṃ.

original: bhaksha la tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
analyzed: bhaksha la tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
translated: The suffix i is from the root bhakṣ, to eat, in the case of the agent.

original: nye bar 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by in the case of the object?🔽 The one who is cruel is uṣṭhaḥ.

original: aushdhra:/ kro sha ti /
analyzed: aushdhra:/ kro sha ti /
translated: The one who is cruel is krośati.

original: brtul zhugs dang yang yang dag la'ang ngo //
analyzed: brtul zhugs dang yang yang dag la'ang ngo //
translated: And also in the case of the suffix of the continuative.

original: ming nye ba'i tshig la byings las brtul zhugs dang yang yang rtogs par bya bzhin pa la'ang ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming nye ba'i tshig la byings las brtul zhugs dang yang yang rtogs par bya bzhin pa la'ang ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the suffix of the continuative, the suffix ni is used after a verbal root in the sense of the continuative.

original: yang yang ni yang yang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang yang ni yang yang du byed pa'o //
translated: The continuative is the repetition of an action.

original: re zhig la brtul zhugs la /
analyzed: re zhig la brtul zhugs la /
translated: First, in the case of the continuative.

original: aa shraddh'a bho dz'i /
analyzed: aa shraddh'a bho dz'i /
translated: Aśraddhabhojī.

original: aa la ba na bho dz'i /🔽shid zan mi za'o //
analyzed: aa la ba na bho dz'i / shid zan mi za'o //
translated: Alavanabhojī.🔽One does not eat food without faith.

original: lan tshva mi za'o zhes la ni ni'o //
analyzed: lan tshva mi za'o zhes la ni ni'o //
translated: One does not eat food without salt.

original: yang yang la /
analyzed: yang yang la /
translated: In the case of the continuative.

original: kshi ra p'a ya ni au sh'i na ra:/
analyzed: kshi ra p'a ya ni au sh'i na ra:/
translated: Kṣīrapāyī ni uśīraḥ.

original: ka sh'a ya p'a yi no g'am dh'a r'a:/
analyzed: ka sh'a ya p'a yi no g'am dh'a r'a:/
translated: Kāṣāyapāyī no gandhādhāraḥ.🔽One drinks milk and uśīra again and again.

original: 'om dang tsab mo yang yang du 'thung bar byed do zhes pa'i don te ;🔽man las te 'dir skyes pa bzhin 'ang ngo //
analyzed: 'om dang tsab mo yang yang du 'thung bar byed do zhes pa'i don te ; man las te 'dir skyes pa bzhin 'ang ngo //
translated: One drinks the decoction and bears the scent.

original: ming nye ba'i tshig la man las ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming nye ba'i tshig la man las ni ni'i rkyen 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of the continuative, the suffix ni is used after a verbal root.

original: 'di dang 'dir yang ni ni'i rkyen gyi mtha' la sngam dang phyi ma'i tshig dang tu ma n+ya ti skyes pa dang yang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dir yang ni ni'i rkyen gyi mtha' la sngam dang phyi ma'i tshig dang tu ma n+ya ti skyes pa dang yang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And here, the final particle ni is like the words of the past and future, and like the affix tva.

original: skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por sgrub pa la skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos po'i tshig ni mi mtshungs par spyir btang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por sgrub pa la skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos po'i tshig ni mi mtshungs par spyir btang ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word tva, which is like the word for a male, is used in the sense of a general statement that is not the same as the thing that is like a male.

original: mdzes par sems la ni /
analyzed: mdzes par sems la ni /
translated: In the mind of the beautiful one,

original: shva bha na m'a n'i pva d'i /
analyzed: shva bha na m'a n'i pva d'i /

original: shes pa ma ni /
analyzed: shes pa ma ni /
translated: śvetā

original: pa tu m'a n'i /
analyzed: pa tu m'a n'i /
translated: pātumāninī

original: pa tv'i 'i sgra skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa tv'i 'i sgra skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: The word pātu is like the word for a male.

original: skyes par bshad pa aung ma yin pa'i mtha' ni skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes par bshad pa aung ma yin pa'i mtha' ni skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos por bshad par bya'o //

original: des na nga dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na nga dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not like this:

analyzed: @282b kha tva m'a ni n'i /

original: khri nas khengs pa can ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khri nas khengs pa can ma zhes pa'o //

original: ni ni'o // ri dang na mtha' rnams las ni a'i'o //
analyzed: ni ni'o // ri dang na mtha' rnams las ni a'i'o //
translated: The final particles ri and na have ai.

original: bdag nyid la kha sha 'ang ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid la kha sha 'ang ngo //
translated: It is oneself.

original: shantring dang a'a na sha dag go //
analyzed: shantring dang a'a na sha dag go //
translated: The words santri and anasha are statements of existence.

original: aan bi / aad sogs las 'jig go //
analyzed: aan bi / aad sogs las 'jig go //
translated: The word anvi is a statement of destruction from as and so forth.

original: di ba sogs las yana\'o //
analyzed: di ba sogs las yana\'o //
translated: The word diva and so forth are statements of the affix ya.

original: aasti'i dang po'i zhes pas aa dbyi'o //
analyzed: aasti'i dang po'i zhes pas aa dbyi'o //
translated: The word asthi is a statement of the initial a.

original: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The word ala is a statement of the a affix from a.

original: gal te dang po dang gzhi gcig ma yin pa smos pa don med do zhe na /🔽de ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dang po dang gzhi gcig ma yin pa smos pa don med do zhe na / de ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that stating initial and not the same basis is meaningless, that is not so.

original: dang po dang gzhi gcig ma yin pa smos pa yod pa min pa ji lta ba kho na /
analyzed: dang po dang gzhi gcig ma yin pa smos pa yod pa min pa ji lta ba kho na /
translated: It is not to be said that way, because stating initial and not the same basis is just as it is not.

original: dang po ma yin pa nyid kyis dang po'i gzhi gcig pa la rtag tu 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar gzhi gcig pa la yang 'gyur bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ma yin pa nyid kyis dang po'i gzhi gcig pa la rtag tu 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar gzhi gcig pa la yang 'gyur bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, just as the first is always changing with respect to a single basis, so too it would be with respect to a single basis, without any difference.

original: de'i phyir de la rtag tu mi 'gyur ro shes pas dang po'i gzhi gcig ma yin pa zhes pa don dang bcas pa'o //🔽bya ba'i mtshon byed rgyud dga la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rtag tu mi 'gyur ro shes pas dang po'i gzhi gcig ma yin pa zhes pa don dang bcas pa'o // bya ba'i mtshon byed rgyud dga la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is always not changing with respect to that. The meaning of “the first is not a single basis” is complete.🔽The verbal root “to indicate” is used for “to cause to flow.”

original: barta m'a n'a zhes pa 'jug ste byung bar gyur pa yang dag par bsngags pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: barta m'a n'a zhes pa 'jug ste byung bar gyur pa yang dag par bsngags pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The verbal root “to praise” is used for “to praise.”

original: rgyu ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rgyu'o //
translated: “Cause” is the cause.

original: gang gi mtshon par byed pa de mtshon byed do //
analyzed: gang gi mtshon par byed pa de mtshon byed do //
translated: That which causes to indicate is the indicator.

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang mtshon byed kyi rgyu dag gi don la byings las da ltar ba la shantring dang aa na sha dag gi rkyen 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang mtshon byed kyi rgyu dag gi don la byings las da ltar ba la shantring dang aa na sha dag gi rkyen 'gyur te /
translated: The present tense of the verbal roots “to cause” and “to indicate” is formed with the suffix -trīṅ and -ana.

original: de dag kyang bya ba'i yul gyi mtshon byed dang rgyu dag la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang bya ba'i yul gyi mtshon byed dang rgyu dag la 'gyur ro //
translated: They are used for the indicator and the cause of the object of action.

original: bya ba gang gis mtshon par byed pa dang bya ba gang gis rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: bya ba gang gis mtshon par byed pa dang bya ba gang gis rgyur 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is: by which action is it indicated, and by which action does it become the cause?

original: re zhig mtshon byed la /
analyzed: re zhig mtshon byed la /
translated: First, with regard to indication,

original: ti shthanto nu sh'as ti ga nak'a:shishya na /🔽shtha 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
analyzed: ti shthanto nu sh'as ti ga nak'a:shishya na / shtha 'gro ba ldog pa la'o //
translated: tiṣṭhanto nu śāsati gāṇakaḥ śiṣye,🔽sthā means to stop.

original: shantringa'o // aan\ bi /
analyzed: shantringa'o // aan\ bi /
translated: śaṃ means to go.🔽an means not.

original: tishtha ru bsgyur ro //
analyzed: tishtha ru bsgyur ro //
translated: tiṣṭha is changed to ru.🔽ja means to go.

original: dzas so // 'dir gnas kyis rjes su bstan pa mtshon par byed pa ste gang gi tshe rtsis mkhan rnams gnas pa de'i tshe slob ma rnams la rjes su ston no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dzas so // 'dir gnas kyis rjes su bstan pa mtshon par byed pa ste gang gi tshe rtsis mkhan rnams gnas pa de'i tshe slob ma rnams la rjes su ston no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, by the word “standing” the instruction is indicated, in the sense that when the astrologers stand, at that time they instruct the students.

original: de bzhin du /🔽sha y'a n'a bhunydza te ya ba na:/
analyzed: de bzhin du / sha y'a n'a bhunydza te ya ba na:/
translated: Similarly,🔽śāyānā bhuñjate yavān,

original: shing nyal ba la'o //
analyzed: shing nyal ba la'o //
translated: śā means to lie down.🔽an means not.

original: a'an sha'o // sh'inga'i byings thams cad la'o //
analyzed: a'an sha'o // sh'inga'i byings thams cad la'o //
translated: śā is the root of all.

original: zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: zhes pas yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality.

original: 'dir nyal bas za ba mtshon par byed pa ste gang gi tshe ya ba na rnams nyal ba de'i tshe za bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir nyal bas za ba mtshon par byed pa ste gang gi tshe ya ba na rnams nyal ba de'i tshe za bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, by the word “lying down” eating is indicated, in the sense that when the yavanas lie down, at that time they eat.

original: rgyu la / aardza ya na ba sa ti /
analyzed: rgyu la / aardza ya na ba sa ti /
translated: With regard to the cause,🔽ardhayānavāsita,

original: aardza so sor 'bad pa la'o //🔽tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
analyzed: aardza so sor 'bad pa la'o // tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
translated: arja for each effort.🔽cur for the sake of itself.

original: shantringa'o // aan bi /
analyzed: shantringa'o // aan bi /
translated: śanta for the sake of the three.

original: yon tan no /
analyzed: yon tan no /
translated: anvi for the sake of the good.

original: 'dir aardza gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dir aardza gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Here arja is the cause of the state.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: aa dh'a y'a no la bha te ka n+y'am /
analyzed: aa dh'a y'a no la bha te ka n+y'am /
translated: adhayāno for the sake of the young.

original: aing glog pa la'o //🔽a'a na sha'o //
analyzed: aing glog pa la'o // a'a na sha'o //
translated: iṅ for the sake of the lightning.🔽āṇa for the sake of the sound.

original: dbyangs dang po la ai ya au lba dag go zhes pas ai ya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang po la ai ya au lba dag go zhes pas ai ya'o //
translated: The first vowel has i, ya, and u.

original: 'dir klog pa mdzes ma thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dir klog pa mdzes ma thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Here the reading is not the cause of the state.

original: mtshon byed dang rgyu dag la ci zhe na /🔽pa tsa ti tsa /
analyzed: mtshon byed dang rgyu dag la ci zhe na / pa tsa ti tsa /
translated: What about the indicative and the cause?🔽pacati for pacati.

original: pa tha ti tsa /🔽'dir 'tshed pa dang @285a * //
analyzed: pa tha ti tsa / 'dir 'tshed pa dang @285a * //
translated: paṭhati for paṭhati.

original: klog pa mtshon byed min zhing rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: klog pa mtshon byed min zhing rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: Here cooking and reading are not the indicative and also not the cause.

original: bya ba'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What about the verbal?

original: drabya gu na yorma bhutra /
analyzed: drabya gu na yorma bhutra /
translated: dṛśyagunayor bhutaḥ.

original: bya ba kho na'i'o //🔽y'a kam pa te so shvattha:/
analyzed: bya ba kho na'i'o // y'a kam pa te so shvattha:/
translated: It is only for the verbal.

original: ka pi g-yo ba la'o //
analyzed: ka pi g-yo ba la'o //
translated: yā for kampa for moving.

original: 'dir g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir g-yo ba'o //
translated: Here it is moving.

original: des na aa shvattha'i rdzas mtshon par bye kyi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na aa shvattha'i rdzas mtshon par bye kyi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the substance of āśvattha is indicated, but the verbal is not.

original: ya du tra pla ba te talla ghu:/
analyzed: ya du tra pla ba te talla ghu:/
translated: yadu trapabā te tllaghu.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why is it not so here?

original: hanti yi ti pa l'a ya te /
analyzed: hanti yi ti pa l'a ya te /
translated: hanti yiti palāyate,

original: barsha ai ti dh'a ba ti /
analyzed: barsha ai ti dh'a ba ti /
translated: varṣa itis dhāvati.

original: ha nan dang barsha na dag pa l'a ya na dang / dh'a ba na dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ha nan dang barsha na dag pa l'a ya na dang / dh'a ba na dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Hanana and varṣaṇa are the cause of palāyana and dhāvana.

original: bden te / ai ti 'dir rgyu brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te / ai ti 'dir rgyu brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: True, but iha does not express a cause here,

original: ai ti'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ai ti'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because there is no iha-case ending.

original: betti las shantring 'i bansu'o //
analyzed: betti las shantring 'i bansu'o //
translated: From vetti, śantrin becomes su.

original: bid shes pa la'o zhes pa 'di las pha rol gyi shantring 'i bansura bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bid shes pa la'o zhes pa 'di las pha rol gyi shantring 'i bansura bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From vid-śeṣa, the su of the other śantrin becomes changed.

original: bi dvan / da ltar ba la shantringa'o //
analyzed: bi dvan / da ltar ba la shantringa'o //
translated: vid-van, in the present, śantrin.

original: 'dis bansu'o // 'dir rnam par brtag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis bansu'o // 'dir rnam par brtag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: By this, su. Here the analysis should be explained.

original: des na / bi dan\/
analyzed: des na / bi dan\/
translated: Therefore, vid-an,

original: a'a na 'dir a'atma ne'o //
analyzed: a'a na 'dir a'atma ne'o //
translated: ā-na here is ā-tman.

original: tshig ces pa 'di phyis pa'o zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: tshig ces pa 'di phyis pa'o zhes gsung ngo //
translated: This word is said to be a suffix.🔽Here, the suffix iha is the indication of the present time.

original: 'dir zhes pa phyis kyi skabs bstan pa 'di dang 'dil //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa phyis kyi skabs bstan pa 'di dang 'dil //
translated: In this and that,

original: kvansu sogs kyi skabs la a'a na gang yin pa de /
analyzed: kvansu sogs kyi skabs la a'a na gang yin pa de /
translated: whatever ā-na there is in the context of kva-su and so on,

original: a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming can du 'gyur zhing shugs las kvansu dang shantring dag par smee'i tshig gi ming can no //
analyzed: a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming can du 'gyur zhing shugs las kvansu dang shantring dag par smee'i tshig gi ming can no //
translated: The root is called an atmane pada root, and the affix is called a saṃdhi.

original: a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming gang du dgos she na /
analyzed: a'atma ne'i tshig gi ming gang du dgos she na /
translated: Where is the atmane pada root required?

original: dngos po dang las dag la a'atm ne'i tshig rnams so zhes pa 'dir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang las dag la a'atm ne'i tshig rnams so zhes pa 'dir ro //
translated: In the case of things and actions, the atmane pada roots are used.🔽cakran🔽bhavati🔽bhuvana🔽duḥkṛt🔽duḥkṛtya

original: tsakra na:/ bya ti ba bhu ba na:/🔽du krinya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: tsakra na:/ bya ti ba bhu ba na:/ du krinya byed pa la'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyam🔽duḥkṛtyā🔽duḥkṛtyāni🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: bh'u yod pa la'o //
analyzed: bh'u yod pa la'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: kvansu dang k'ana'o //
analyzed: kvansu dang k'ana'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: gnyis brjod do //🔽bha ba ti'i aa'o //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do // bha ba ti'i aa'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: bhu'i mtha' wa'o //
analyzed: bhu'i mtha' wa'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: pra sth'i ya m'a nam /🔽shth'a gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: pra sth'i ya m'a nam / shth'a gnas pa la'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: da ltar ba la shantring a'an sha'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la shantring a'an sha'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
analyzed: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: da ma ga ya ti zhes pas a'i nyid do //
analyzed: da ma ga ya ti zhes pas a'i nyid do //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: aa las a'a na lam mtha'o zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aa las a'a na lam mtha'o zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: ai dh'i ya m'a nam /
analyzed: ai dh'i ya m'a nam /
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: aing klog pa la'o //
analyzed: aing klog pa la'o //
translated: duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ🔽duḥkṛtyāḥ

original: aa dhi sngon du'o //
analyzed: aa dhi sngon du'o //
translated: duḥk

original: snga ma bzhin du a'a na sha dang yan dang ma a'a ga ma 'ang ngo //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du a'a na sha dang yan dang ma a'a ga ma 'ang ngo //
translated: As before, ānaśa and yāna.

original: a'as las de'i ai'o //
analyzed: a'as las de'i ai'o //
translated: From ā, the i of that.

original: a'as las pha rol gyi a'a ni'i rkyen /
analyzed: a'as las pha rol gyi a'a ni'i rkyen /
translated: From ā, the ā of the other side is the condition.

original: a'i nyid du 'gyur te pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes pas a'a yig gi'o //
analyzed: a'i nyid du 'gyur te pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes pas a'a yig gi'o //
translated: It becomes ā itself. The first transformation is in the action of the other side. Thus, it is of the letter ā.🔽Āsāniḥ.

original: a'a s'a ni:/ a'as nye bar sdod pa la'o //
analyzed: a'a s'a ni:/ a'as nye bar sdod pa la'o //
translated: Ā is for approaching.

original: da ltar ba la shanting a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la shanting a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
translated: In the present, śāntiṅ ānaśa. Thus, ānaśa.

original: 'dis a'i nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis a'i nyid do //
translated: By this, it is ā itself.

original: de'i smos pa ni sh'a nang gi yang a'i nyid kyi don de rang bzhin nyid nra a'a na'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i smos pa ni sh'a nang gi yang a'i nyid kyi don de rang bzhin nyid nra a'a na'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The mention of that is for the meaning of ā itself within śān. That nature itself is the condition of āna.🔽By that,

original: des na / ka t'i ho d'a sva n'i:/
analyzed: des na / ka t'i ho d'a sva n'i:/
translated: katī ho dāsva nīḥ.

original: a'a pa'i sngon du au'o//
analyzed: a'a pa'i sngon du au'o//
translated: Before ā, au.

original: @285b shin tu sdod par nus so zhes nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i ngang tshul la sh'a nanga'o //
analyzed: @285b shin tu sdod par nus so zhes nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i ngang tshul la sh'a nanga'o //
translated: It is able to remain very well. Thus, it is able, age, and that nature. Within śān.

original: 'dis a'i nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis a'i nyid do //
translated: By this, it is ā itself.

original: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o //
analyzed: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o //
translated: From a, āna. Not the end.

original: a'a las zhes pa drug pa'i gnas la lnga pa ste /
analyzed: a'a las zhes pa drug pa'i gnas la lnga pa ste /
translated: From ā, the sixth place is the fifth.

original: des na aa'i ste aa yig mtha'i sgra'i a'a na'i rkyen pha rol la ma yig a'a ga ma 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na aa'i ste aa yig mtha'i sgra'i a'a na'i rkyen pha rol la ma yig a'a ga ma 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the a of the a at the end of the sound a, the condition of the ana, becomes the ma of the ma, the following.

original: pa tsa ma na:/
analyzed: pa tsa ma na:/
translated: pa ca ma naḥ.

original: da ltar ba la shantring a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la shantring a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
translated: In the present, the śa of śa-nta-tri-ṅa-a-na-śa.🔽aṇ-vi.

original: aan bi / 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aan bi / 'dis ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: This is the ma of the ma-ga-ma.

original: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the a from a?🔽 su-nva-naḥ.

original: su nv'a na:/ a'a na sha'o //
analyzed: su nv'a na:/ a'a na sha'o //
translated: The śa of śa-nta-tri-ṅa-a-na-śa.

original: bi ka ra na'i nu'i wa yig go zhes pas wa nyi do //🔽pung ya dza dag gi sh'a nanga'o //
analyzed: bi ka ra na'i nu'i wa yig go zhes pas wa nyi do // pung ya dza dag gi sh'a nanga'o //
translated: The vi of vi-ka-ra-ṇa-nī-va-ya.🔽The ṅa of puṅ-ya-ja-śa-na.

original: pung dang ya dzan las sha nang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pung dang ya dzan las sha nang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From puṅ and ya-jana, the ṅa becomes the ṅa of the following.

original: pa ba m'a na: //
analyzed: pa ba m'a na: //
translated: pa ba mā naḥ.

original: ya dza m'a na:/🔽shva nanga'o ; aan bi //
analyzed: ya dza m'a na:/ shva nanga'o ; aan bi //
translated: ya ja mā naḥ.🔽The śa of śa-na.🔽 aṇ-vi.

original: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The ma of the ma-ga-ma from the a of a-na-la-ma-m-a.

original: nga yig rjes su 'brel pa byed pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
analyzed: nga yig rjes su 'brel pa byed pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
translated: The connection with the letter ṅ is for the sake of the following.

original: das ltar ba la shantring aa'a na sha dag go zhes pa 'di nyid de'i rab tu spros pas sh'a nang gi rkyen mdo 'dis bya'o //
analyzed: das ltar ba la shantring aa'a na sha dag go zhes pa 'di nyid de'i rab tu spros pas sh'a nang gi rkyen mdo 'dis bya'o //
translated: Thus, the śa of śa-nta-tri-ṅa-a-na-śa is just this. By the elaboration of that, the condition of the ṅa of śa-na should be made by this sūtra.

original: nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i ngang tshul la'o //
analyzed: nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i ngang tshul la'o //
translated: [The affix] śan is added to the root [to form] a noun in the sense of ability, age, and condition.

original: nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i dang tshul rtogs par bya bzhin pa la byings las sh'a nang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang na tshod dang de'i dang tshul rtogs par bya bzhin pa la byings las sh'a nang pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: 'o na wun tri tsa dag go zhes pas kshi pa sogs rnams las buna'i rkyen grub pa las 'di don med cing bun smos pa de'i dang tshul la sogs pa rnams kyi don la ghi nina yin gyi buna 'gegs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na wun tri tsa dag go zhes pas kshi pa sogs rnams las buna'i rkyen grub pa las 'di don med cing bun smos pa de'i dang tshul la sogs pa rnams kyi don la ghi nina yin gyi buna 'gegs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one says, “Oh, it is the case of the uṇ affix,” then the uṇ affix is established from the kṣip and so on affixes, and this is meaningless. And the mention of uṇ is blocked by the mention of the kṣip affix and so on.

original: mi 'gyur te bud med la gzugs mtshungs pa yang na'o zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te bud med la gzugs mtshungs pa yang na'o zhes pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because of the word yānnā, which means “in the same form as a woman.”

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste bun smos pas 'di shes par byed de /🔽de'i ngang tshul la sogs pa'i skabs la byas pa'i rkyen rnams kyi de'i dang tshul la sogs pa'i skabs la byas pa dang lhan cig bsgrub pa'i gzugs mtshungs pa yang na med do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste bun smos pas 'di shes par byed de / de'i ngang tshul la sogs pa'i skabs la byas pa'i rkyen rnams kyi de'i dang tshul la sogs pa'i skabs la byas pa dang lhan cig bsgrub pa'i gzugs mtshungs pa yang na med do zhes pa ste /
translated: Here it is said: This is understood by the mention of uṇ.🔽The affixes that are taken to be in the context of the kṣip affix and so on are not in the context of the affixes that are taken to be in the context of the kṣip affix and so on.

original: des nakshir sogs rnams las de'i dang tshul las so zhes pa'i don rnams la grub pa'i gzugs mtshungs pas yang na trin la sogs pa rnams thob pa ma yin te nges na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nakshir sogs rnams las de'i dang tshul las so zhes pa'i don rnams la grub pa'i gzugs mtshungs pas yang na trin la sogs pa rnams thob pa ma yin te nges na 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the affixes kṣip and so on do not obtain the forms that are established from the affixes that are taken to be in the context of the kṣip affix and so on, because of the word yānnā.

original: nindi hi sa kli sha kh'ad /

original: kandu sogs yan @288a * //

analyzed: kli sha spyi'o //

analyzed: kh'a dri za ba la'o //

original: 'di rnams dang / de bzhin du dbyangs gcig pa min pa dang / bi sngon ma can gyi n'a shi ain mtha' las dang / dbyangs sngon ma can gyi bh'asha las dang aa su ya'i sgra dang kandu la sogs pa yana'i mtha' las bunya 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams dang / de bzhin du dbyangs gcig pa min pa dang / bi sngon ma can gyi n'a shi ain mtha' las dang / dbyangs sngon ma can gyi bh'asha las dang aa su ya'i sgra dang kandu la sogs pa yana'i mtha' las bunya 'gyur ro //
translated: And from these, and similarly from the non-one-vowel ones, the vi-naśa with the final i, the bhaya with the initial vowel, and the aśu-ya sound, and the kaṇḍu, etc., ending in ya, the affix bhya is formed.

analyzed: nandi ka:/ hi sa ka:/

analyzed: dbyangs gcig pa min pa rnams las /

analyzed: da ri dra ti'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la'o zhes pas ya dbyi ba thob ste ;
translated: Dari is for all roots, except for the aṇ-ādi class. Thus, the ya-ādeśa is obtained.

original: 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa les /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa les /
translated: The world's usage is not

original: da ri dr'a ya ka:/
analyzed: da ri dr'a ya ka:/

original: zhes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes par mi 'gyur ro //

original: ganaka:/ gana las tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //
analyzed: ganaka:/ gana las tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir aina'o //

original: aa'i yang dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //

original: bi n'a sha ka:/
analyzed: bi n'a sha ka:/
translated: Vināśaka.

original: rnam par 'joms par byed du 'jug go zhes la aina 'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms par byed du 'jug go zhes la aina 'o //

original: bunya'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: bunya'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //

original: bya bh'asha ka:/ aa s'u ya ka:/
analyzed: bya bh'asha ka:/ aa s'u ya ka:/

original: aa su'i sgra las kandu sogs nyid kyi phyir yana'o //
analyzed: aa su'i sgra las kandu sogs nyid kyi phyir yana'o //
translated: Make it - from the word asū comes ka and so on, so i is added.

original: n'a mina'i mtha' rnams kyi yan zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: n'a mina'i mtha' rnams kyi yan zhes pas ring po'o //

original: bunya'o // aa'i yang dbyi'o //🔽'o na bi n'a shi dbyangs gcig min pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bunya'o // aa'i yang dbyi'o // 'o na bi n'a shi dbyangs gcig min pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /

original: 'di'i dpe brjod pa las logs su byas pa don med do zhe na bden te /
analyzed: 'di'i dpe brjod pa las logs su byas pa don med do zhe na bden te /
translated: But since vināśa is not a single vowel, it is treated separately from the examples - is this not pointless? It is true,

original: nges pa'i don du ste ain mtha'i dbyangs gcig min gyi bi n'a shi nyid kyi ji lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du ste ain mtha'i dbyangs gcig min gyi bi n'a shi nyid kyi ji lta bar 'gyur la /

original: 'dir mi 'gyur bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'dir mi 'gyur bar byas nas /

original: k'a ra yi t'a /
analyzed: k'a ra yi t'a /

original: trin dang aita'o //
analyzed: trin dang aita'o //

original: aa su ya'i sgra'i yang nges pa'i don du dpe brjod pa ni yana'i rkyen mtha'i dbyangs gcig min gyi aa su ya'i sgra nyid kyi ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba la 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: aa su ya'i sgra'i yang nges pa'i don du dpe brjod pa ni yana'i rkyen mtha'i dbyangs gcig min gyi aa su ya'i sgra nyid kyi ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba la 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: As for the sound asūya, the example of the certain meaning is not a single vowel at the end of the condition of ya, but it is as it is in the sound asūya itself.

original: kandu yi ta /
analyzed: kandu yi ta /

original: kanduya'i sgra las yana'o //
analyzed: kanduya'i sgra las yana'o //

original: trina'o // aa'i yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: trina'o // aa'i yang dbyi'o //

analyzed: dkyus ma'i buna la bunya smos pa ni ghi nin yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o // nyer bsgyur la de wa kru sha dag gi 'ang ngo //

original: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la de bi rtse ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i ain mtha' las dang kru sha las kyang bunya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la de bi rtse ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i ain mtha' las dang kru sha las kyang bunya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: a'a de ba ka:/
analyzed: a'a de ba ka:/

original: a'a kro sha ka:/🔽nyer bsgyur la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: a'a kro sha ka:/ nyer bsgyur la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: de ba yi t'a /

analyzed: zlas dbye khong na gnas pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //

analyzed: du pa ma skyug pa la'o //

analyzed: bya tha'i sngon du na nya'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams las aina pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: dza y'i / aa y'i /
analyzed: dza y'i / aa y'i /

original: da r'i / ksha y'i /
analyzed: da r'i / ksha y'i /

original: bi shra y'i /
analyzed: bi shra y'i /

original: pa ri bha b'i /
analyzed: pa ri bha b'i /
translated: Paribhava,

original: ba m'i / aa bhya m'i /
analyzed: ba m'i / aa bhya m'i /
translated: Vama, abhyāma,

original: aa bya th'i /
analyzed: aa bya th'i /

analyzed: da yi pa ti gri hi sbri hi shraddha tantrani tra rnams las a'a lu'o //

original: da ya sbyin pa dang 'gro ba dang bsrung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: da ya sbyin pa dang 'gro ba dang bsrung ba rnams la'o //

original: pa da 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: pa da 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Pada means going.

original: gri ha 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: gri ha 'dzin pa la'o //

original: spri ha 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: spri ha 'dod pa la'o //

original: gsum ni tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir ain mtha'o //
analyzed: gsum ni tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir ain mtha'o //
translated: The three are at the end of i because of the nature of cu and so on.

original: shrad sngon ma las dhanya'o //
analyzed: shrad sngon ma las dhanya'o //

original: tantra zhes pa mdo las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tantra zhes pa mdo las 'byung ba'o //

original: dra smad pa dang 'gro ba @289b la'o ;
analyzed: dra smad pa dang 'gro ba @289b la'o ;

original: / ni sngon du'o //
analyzed: / ni sngon du'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams las aa lu pha rol tu 'gyur ro // da y'a lu:/ pa da y'a lu:/
translated: Of these, ālu is for parā.🔽Dayāluḥ, padayāluḥ,

original: gri ha y'a lu:/
analyzed: gri ha y'a lu:/
translated: grīhāluḥ,

original: spri ha y'a lu:/
analyzed: spri ha y'a lu:/
translated: spṛhāluḥ.

original: pa di dang gri hi dang spri hi rnams las aina'o //
analyzed: pa di dang gri hi dang spri hi rnams las aina'o //
translated: In pada, grīva, and spṛhā, iṇa is for ai.

original: aa'i yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'o //

original: aa lu aishnu zhes pas k'a ri ta dbyi ba med do //
analyzed: aa lu aishnu zhes pas k'a ri ta dbyi ba med do //

original: shraddh'a lu:/ tandra lu:/
analyzed: shraddh'a lu:/ tandra lu:/

original: ni dra lu:/ shing las kyang 'dod de ;
analyzed: ni dra lu:/ shing las kyang 'dod de ;

original: sha y'a lu:/ shi ta aushna dag las kyang lhan cig pa min pa la'o //
analyzed: sha y'a lu:/ shi ta aushna dag las kyang lhan cig pa min pa la'o //

analyzed: sh'i ta dang aushna'i sgra dag las lhan cig pa min pa'i byed pa po la a'a lu pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: stabs gcig pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don ni /
analyzed: stabs gcig pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of asahita is

original: lhan cig pa min pa ste patsa sogs nyid kyi phyir aatsa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig pa min pa ste patsa sogs nyid kyi phyir aatsa'o //

original: grang ba dang bcas pa min pa ni ;
analyzed: grang ba dang bcas pa min pa ni ;
translated: Not cold is🔽sita.🔽Not warm is

original: sh'i t'a lu:/ dro ba dang bcas pa min pa ni /
analyzed: sh'i t'a lu:/ dro ba dang bcas pa min pa ni /
translated: usnala.

original: aushna lu:/ shadi sadi dhe ta d'a si rnams las ru'o //
analyzed: aushna lu:/ shadi sadi dhe ta d'a si rnams las ru'o //

original: sha di sa di dang dheta ces pa 'di rnams dang du d'a nya sbyin pa la'o //
analyzed: sha di sa di dang dheta ces pa 'di rnams dang du d'a nya sbyin pa la'o //

analyzed: shi 'ching ba la'o zhes pa 'di dag las kyang ru'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: sha dru:/ sa dru:/
analyzed: sha dru:/ sa dru:/

original: dh'a ru:/ d'a ru:/
analyzed: dh'a ru:/ d'a ru:/
translated: daru,

original: se ru:/ sri aa di ghas rnams kyi mar ka'o //
analyzed: se ru:/ sri aa di ghas rnams kyi mar ka'o //
translated: seru, and sri are maraka.

original: sri 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: sri 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Sri means to go.

original: aad za ba la'o //
analyzed: aad za ba la'o //
translated: Adi means to eat.

original: gha si mdo las 'byug ba'i byings so //
analyzed: gha si mdo las 'byug ba'i byings so //

original: 'di rnams las ma ra ka pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ma ra ka pha rol tu 'gyur ro //

original: sri ma ra:/ aasma ra:/
analyzed: sri ma ra:/ aasma ra:/
translated: Sri, asmara,

original: ghasma ra:/ mi di bha si bhanydza rnams kyi ghu ra'o //
analyzed: ghasma ra:/ mi di bha si bhanydza rnams kyi ghu ra'o //
translated: ghasmara, and midibhasbhanjara have ghur.

original: 'di rnams las ghu ra pha rol tu 'gyur ro //🔽me dur:/ p'a shur:/
analyzed: 'di rnams las ghu ra pha rol tu 'gyur ro // me dur:/ p'a shur:/
translated: From these, ghur becomes para.🔽Medura,🔽pasura,🔽bhasura, bhangura,

original: bh'a su ra:/ bham gur:/🔽tsa dza dag gi zhes pas ga nyid do //
analyzed: bh'a su ra:/ bham gur:/🔽tsa dza dag gi zhes pas ga nyid do //

original: bham dza las byed pa po la sbyor ba'i byed pa po tsam min no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bham dza las byed pa po la sbyor ba'i byed pa po tsam min no zhes smra'o //

original: de bzhin du phyi ma la tshi di dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma la tshi di dag go //

original: tshi di bhi di bi da rnams kyi ku ra'o //
analyzed: tshi di bhi di bi da rnams kyi ku ra'o //

original: 'di rnams las ku ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ku ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: tshi dur:/ bhi du ra:/
analyzed: tshi dur:/ bhi du ra:/
translated: The tși-s, the bhi-s,

original: bi du ra:/ bi da shes pa'i ming don gzung bar bya'i gzhan ma yin te mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bi du ra:/ bi da shes pa'i ming don gzung bar bya'i gzhan ma yin te mngon par brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the vi-s are the names of the knowers, not others, because they are not expressions.

original: dza gri las a'u ka'o //
analyzed: dza gri las a'u ka'o //

original: dz'a garti las a'u ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dz'a garti las a'u ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: dz'a ga r'u ka:/🔽tso kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams kyi ya dzidza pi dam sha bad rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dz'a ga r'u ka:/ tso kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams kyi ya dzidza pi dam sha bad rnams kyi'o //

original: ya dzi dang dza pi dang dam shi dang ba di rnams tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams las a'u ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro//🔽y'a ya dzu ka:/🔽dzam dza b'u ka:/
analyzed: ya dzi dang dza pi dang dam shi dang ba di rnams tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams las a'u ka'i rkyen 'gyur ro// y'a ya dzu ka:/ dzam dza b'u ka:/
translated: The ya-s, the jī-s, the jī-s, and the va-s have the condition of the cakorī-tā-s.🔽The ya-s, the ya-jī-s,🔽the ja-va-s,

original: dam da shu ka:/
analyzed: dam da shu ka:/
translated: the ja-mī-s,

original: b'a ba du ka:/
analyzed: b'a ba du ka:/
translated: and the va-va-s.

original: shin tu mchod par byed do //
analyzed: shin tu mchod par byed do //
translated: They make extremely great offerings.

original: gsang nas bzlas par byed do //
analyzed: gsang nas bzlas par byed do //
translated: It is whispered.

original: de bzhin du za bar byad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du za bar byad do //

original: shin tu smra bar byed do zhes pas ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu smra bar byed do zhes pas ya sgra'o //
translated: It is spoken very much.🔽The ya sound is from ja, etc.

original: dza pa sogs rnams kyi 'ang ngo zhes pas rjes su nga ro a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: dza pa sogs rnams kyi 'ang ngo zhes pas rjes su nga ro a'a ga ma'o //

original: 'di sa a'u ka'o //🔽aa'i yang dbyi'o// @290a * //
analyzed: 'di sa a'u ka'o // aa'i yang dbyi'o// @290a * //
