original: ya'i aan min pa la zhes pas ya yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: ya'i aan min pa la zhes pas ya yig dbyi'o //
translated: The ya is a vowel, not an an.

original: a'a ga ma med ba'i mtha'i ring po zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: a'a ga ma med ba'i mtha'i ring po zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long [vowel] is the long one at the end without āgama.

original: de'i aa tsa la 'jig go //
analyzed: de'i aa tsa la 'jig go //
translated: Its a is destroyed.

original: de'i ste tsa kr'i yita'i aatsa pha rol la 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ste tsa kr'i yita'i aatsa pha rol la 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Its ca is destroyed on the other side of the kṛt.

original: lo lu ba:/ popub:/
analyzed: lo lu ba:/ popub:/
translated: lo lu

original: shin tu gcod par byed do //
analyzed: shin tu gcod par byed do //
translated: It is cut very much.

original: shin tu dag par byed do la ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu dag par byed do la ya sgra'o //
translated: It is purified very much.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: It is said twice.

original: patsa sogs rnams las aatsa 'ang ngo zhes pas aatsa'o //
analyzed: patsa sogs rnams las aatsa 'ang ngo zhes pas aatsa'o //
translated: The a is from pa, etc.

original: 'dis ya sgra 'jig go //
analyzed: 'dis ya sgra 'jig go //

original: na rjes su 'brel pa zhes sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa las yon tan med do //
analyzed: na rjes su 'brel pa zhes sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa las yon tan med do //
translated: The connection with na is not a rule.

original: dbyangs dang po la aiya au wa dag ces pas au wa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang po la aiya au wa dag ces pas au wa'o //
translated: The first vowel is ā, i, u, and va.

original: de las y'a ti las ba ra'o //
analyzed: de las y'a ti las ba ra'o //
translated: From that, ya and ti become ba and ra.🔽The final of ce and kṛ becomes ya.🔽This ya is obtained from the case la.

original: tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' de las y'a ti ste ya thob pa la'o zhes pa 'di las ba ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' de las y'a ti ste ya thob pa la'o zhes pa 'di las ba ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From this, the condition of ba ra arises.

original: y'a y'a ba ra:/
analyzed: y'a y'a ba ra:/
translated: Ya ya ba ra.

original: shin tu thob par byed do la bshad pa las ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu thob par byed do la bshad pa las ya sgra'o //
translated: It is explained that ya is the sound of the case la.

original: 'dis ba ra'i rkyen no //
analyzed: 'dis ba ra'i rkyen no //
translated: By this, the condition of ba ra is [explained].

original: aa'i 'ang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i 'ang dbyi'o //
translated: Ā is also a vowel.

original: gsal byed la ya ba dag gi zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
analyzed: gsal byed la ya ba dag gi zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
translated: The consonants are ya and va.

original: 'o na dbyangs bsgyur ba yongs su bshad pas aa yig dbyi ba gnas can dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gsal byed pha rol tu gyur pa nyid las ya dbyi ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbyangs bsgyur ba yongs su bshad pas aa yig dbyi ba gnas can dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gsal byed pha rol tu gyur pa nyid las ya dbyi ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the explanation of the transformation of vowels is like the case of the elimination of a, then how does the elimination of ya occur from the consonants alone?

original: 'di yod mod 'on kyang ya dbyi ba'i sgrub pa rab tu 'gegs pa la gnas can dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ya dbyi ba'i sgrub pa so sor gnas can bzhin min no zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: 'di yod mod 'on kyang ya dbyi ba'i sgrub pa rab tu 'gegs pa la gnas can dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba ya dbyi ba'i sgrub pa so sor gnas can bzhin min no zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: This is true, but the proof of the elimination of ya is like the case of the base. The proof of the elimination of ya is not like the individual bases. This is understood from the words.

original: ka si pi si bh'a si a'i sha stha'a pra mad rnams kyi 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ka si pi si bh'a si a'i sha stha'a pra mad rnams kyi 'ang ngo //
translated: The k, s, s, s, a, śa, sthā, and pra of the Madra country.

original: kas 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: kas 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Ka is for going.

original: pe sri 'gro ba la'o //🔽bh'a sri gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: pe sri 'gro ba la'o // bh'a sri gsal ba la'o //
translated: Pa is for going.🔽Bhā is for shining.

original: a'i sha dbang phyug la'o //
analyzed: a'i sha dbang phyug la'o //
translated: Aiśa is for Īśvara.

original: shtha gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: shtha gnas pa la'o //
translated: Stha is for abiding.

original: ma d'i dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: ma d'i dga' ba la'o //
translated: Ma is for joy.

original: pra sngon du'o //
analyzed: pra sngon du'o //
translated: Pra is for before.

original: 'di rnams las wa ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las wa ra'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: Of these, the kṛt suffix is added.🔽Ka-sarah,

original: ka sa ra:/ pa sve ra:/
analyzed: ka sa ra:/ pa sve ra:/
translated: pa-sve-rah,🔽bhā-sve-rah,

original: bh'a sva ra:/ a'i shva ra:/
analyzed: bh'a sva ra:/ a'i shva ra:/
translated: aiśva-ra,🔽sthā-varah,

original: stha bar:/ pra ma dvar:/
analyzed: stha bar:/ pra ma dvar:/
translated: pra-mada-varah.

original: sgra ldan dang zhes pas aita med do //🔽sri dzri ain na sha rnams kyi kvara pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ldan dang zhes pas aita med do // sri dzri ain na sha rnams kyi kvara pa'o //
translated: With “having a sound,” there is no iṭ.🔽The kṛt suffix is added to sṛ, jṛ, iṇ, and ṇaś.

original: sri dang dzi dang aina dang na sha zhes pa 'di rnams las kar pa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sri dang dzi dang aina dang na sha zhes pa 'di rnams las kar pa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: Sṛ, jṛ, iṇ, and ṇaś—the kṛt suffix is added to these.🔽Sṛt-varah,🔽sṛt-varī,

original: sritvar:/ sritvar'i:/ dzi tvara:/
analyzed: sritvar:/ sritvar'i:/ dzi tvara:/
translated: jṛt-varah,🔽iṇ-varah,

original: aitva ra:/ na shvar:/
analyzed: aitva ra:/ na shvar:/
translated: ṇaś-varah.

original: byings kyi mtha' ta'o //
analyzed: byings kyi mtha' ta'o //
translated: The final of the root is ta.

original: ga ma'i ta 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ga ma'i ta 'ang ngo //
translated: Ga is also.

original: gam las kva rab pha rol tu 'gyur zhing ta yig tu bsgyur ba 'ang ngo //
analyzed: gam las kva rab pha rol tu 'gyur zhing ta yig tu bsgyur ba 'ang ngo //
translated: From ga, kṛt becomes parā, and ta is changed.

analyzed: ga tva ra:/ d'i pi kampi aa dza si him si ka mi sming nam rnams kyi ra'o //

original: d'i pi gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: d'i pi gsal ba la'o //
translated: Dip means to shine.

original: kampi 'dar ba la'o //
analyzed: kampi 'dar ba la'o //
translated: Kamp means to tremble.

original: dzasu grol ba la'o //
analyzed: dzasu grol ba la'o //
translated: Jasi means to be released.

original: nanya sngon du'o //
analyzed: nanya sngon du'o //
translated: Nyan means before.

original: hi sihim sa 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: hi sihim sa 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Hiṃsā means to injure.

original: ka mu mdzes pa la'o //
analyzed: ka mu mdzes pa la'o //
translated: Ka means beautiful.

original: sming 'dzum pa la'o //
analyzed: sming 'dzum pa la'o //
translated: Smiṃ means to smile.

original: @290b nam 'dud pa la ste sgra la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: @290b nam 'dud pa la ste sgra la 'ang ngo //

original: 'di rnams las ra'i rkyan 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ra'i rkyan 'gyur ro //

original: d'i pra:/ kampra:/ aadzasri:/
analyzed: d'i pra:/ kampra:/ aadzasri:/
translated: ajasiḥ,🔽hiṃsraḥ,🔽kaḥ,🔽smin,

original: himsra:/ ka ma:/ smer:/
analyzed: himsra:/ ka ma:/ smer:/
translated: namraḥ, etc.

original: na mra:/ snga ma bzhin du aita med do //
analyzed: na mra:/ snga ma bzhin du aita med do //

analyzed: san mtha' dang a'a sham si dang bhiksha rnams kyi au'o //

analyzed: byings san mtha' can dang a'ang sngon ma'i sham si dang bhi ksha las kyang au'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: From the root san, the final, and aśams before a, and bhikṣ, etc., the affix au is added.

original: byed par 'dod do la /
analyzed: byed par 'dod do la /
translated: It is desired to be made.🔽Cākārṣīt,

original: tsa k'i rshu:/ 'tshed par 'dod do la /
analyzed: tsa k'i rshu:/ 'tshed par 'dod do la /
translated: it is desired to cook.🔽Paskārṣīt,

original: pi sakshu:/ au'i rkyen no //
analyzed: pi sakshu:/ au'i rkyen no //
translated: the affix au.

original: aa'i yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'o //
translated: Ai is also a vowel.

original: a'a sham su:/ bhi kshu:/
analyzed: a'a sham su:/ bhi kshu:/
translated: Aśams, bhikṣ, etc.

original: bhindhu dang aitstshu yang ngo //
analyzed: bhindhu dang aitstshu yang ngo //

original: bindhu dang aitstshu'o //
analyzed: bindhu dang aitstshu'o //

original: zhes pa'i sgra 'di dag tshig phrad do //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sgra 'di dag tshig phrad do //

original: bi di las au'i rkyen dang ni yi ga a'a ga ma'ang ngo //
analyzed: bi di las au'i rkyen dang ni yi ga a'a ga ma'ang ngo //
translated: From vid, the condition of u and the affix ya.

original: ai shi'i aatstsha nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: ai shi'i aatstsha nyid kyang ngo //
translated: And the aṇ of iṣ.

original: a'a ta ri yig mtha' au pa dh'a phyis pa rnams kyi ki ste gnyis dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: a'a ta ri yig mtha' au pa dh'a phyis pa rnams kyi ki ste gnyis dag kyang ngo //
translated: The a of āt and the affix ri, the end of the letter, are removed.

original: gang rnams kyi au pa dh'a phyis pa yod pa de rnams ni au pa dh'a phyis pa can no //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi au pa dh'a phyis pa yod pa de rnams ni au pa dh'a phyis pa can no //
translated: Those that have the removal of upa are those with the removal of upa.

original: a'ata dang ri yig dang au pa dh'a phyis pa can zhes zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: a'ata dang ri yig dang au pa dh'a phyis pa can zhes zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The compound is “having the end of the letter āt and ri and the removal of upa.”

original: aa yig mtha' can rnams dang ri yig mtha' can rnams dang aup dh'a phyis pa can rnams kyi ki'i rkyen 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: aa yig mtha' can rnams dang ri yig mtha' can rnams dang aup dh'a phyis pa can rnams kyi ki'i rkyen 'gyur zhing /
translated: The condition of ki is for those that end in the letter a, those that end in the letter ri, and those that have the removal of upa.

original: 'di rnams kyi 'ang gzugs gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi 'ang gzugs gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: And the form of these becomes twofold.

original: tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the words become twofold.

original: a'a yig gi mtha' can rnams las /
analyzed: a'a yig gi mtha' can rnams las /
translated: From those that end in the letter ā,🔽iḥ,🔽dḥ,

original: ai:/ dhi:/ pa 'thung ba la'o //
analyzed: ai:/ dhi:/ pa 'thung ba la'o //
translated: pa is for drinking.

original: dhu dh'a nya 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: dhu dh'a nya 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: Dhūdhānyādhānaṃ.

original: ki'i rkyen no //
analyzed: ki'i rkyen no //
translated: The affix ki.

original: gnyis brjod do// byings thams cad pa min pa la a'a dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do// byings thams cad pa min pa la a'a dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: The two are expressed. Since it is said that the affix ā is for all roots except those that are not, the letter a is the affix.

original: ri yig gi mtha' can rnams las /
analyzed: ri yig gi mtha' can rnams las /
translated: From those that end in the letter ri,

original: tsa kri:/ pa sri:/
analyzed: tsa kri:/ pa sri:/
translated: cakriḥ, pasriḥ,

original: dukri gsum byed pa pa'o //
analyzed: dukri gsum byed pa pa'o //
translated: dukriḥ are the three agents.

original: pri 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: pri 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Priḥ is for going.

original: au pa dha phyis pa can rnams las /
analyzed: au pa dha phyis pa can rnams las /
translated: From those that have upa,

original: dza dznyi:/ tsakhni:/ dzan skye ba la'o //
analyzed: dza dznyi:/ tsakhni:/ dzan skye ba la'o //
translated: ja jñih, chaknih, jan is for birth.

original: kha nu nges par 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: kha nu nges par 'joms pa la'o //
translated: Khanu is for certain destruction.

original: gam han dzan khan zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: gam han dzan khan zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
translated: Since it is said ghaṃ jhaṃ khaṃ, upa is the affix.

original: sa hi tsa li ba hi ba di pa ti rnams las kyang tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams las kyi'i rkyen bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sa hi tsa li ba hi ba di pa ti rnams las kyang tse kr'i yi ta'i mtha' rnams las kyi'i rkyen bshad par bya ste /
translated: From sahi, cali, bāhi, and pati, the affixes ki and ti are explained from the ends of the letters ce and kṛ.

original: s'a sa hi:/ ts'a tsa li:/
analyzed: s'a sa hi:/ ts'a tsa li:/
translated: Saḥ sahiḥ, chaḥ caliḥ,

original: b'a ba ti:/ b'a ba di:/
analyzed: b'a ba ti:/ b'a ba di:/
translated: bāḥ bāhiḥ, bāḥ bāḍiḥ,🔽pāḥ patiḥ,

original: p'a pa ti:/ sha ha bzod pa la'o //
analyzed: p'a pa ti:/ sha ha bzod pa la'o //
translated: śaḥ sahaḥ is for forbearance.

original: tsal 'dar ba la'o //
analyzed: tsal 'dar ba la'o //
translated: Cal is for trembling.

original: bah thob pa la'o //
analyzed: bah thob pa la'o //
translated: Bā is for attainment.

original: bad gsal bar brjod pa la'o ;
analyzed: bad gsal bar brjod pa la'o ;
translated: Bāḍi is for clear expression.

original: / patli 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: / patli 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Patiḥ is for going.

original: ya sgra'o // bshad pa las ki'o //
analyzed: ya sgra'o // bshad pa las ki'o //
translated: Ya is sound. It is explained from the affix ki.

original: aa'i yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'o //
translated: The ai is the ending.

original: ya'i aan min pa la zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
analyzed: ya'i aan min pa la zhes pas ya dbyi'o //
translated: The ya is the ending.

original: tri shi dhri shi sva pa rnams kyi na dzinga'o //
analyzed: tri shi dhri shi sva pa rnams kyi na dzinga'o //
translated: The na is the ending of triṣi, dṛṣi, and svapa.

original: 'di rnams las ni dzid rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ni dzid rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: The na is the ending of these.

original: trishna ka / dhrishn ka / svapna ka / snga ma bzhin du aita med do //🔽shri bam di dag gi @291a * //
analyzed: trishna ka / dhrishn ka / svapna ka / snga ma bzhin du aita med do // shri bam di dag gi @291a * //
translated: Trisam, dṛṣam, svapam, as before, without it.🔽The ā is the ending of śri and vam.

original: a'a ru'o ; / shr'i 'tsha ba la'o //
analyzed: a'a ru'o ; / shr'i 'tsha ba la'o //
translated: Śrī is for “prosperity.”

original: ba di mngo par 'dud pa la'o //
analyzed: ba di mngo par 'dud pa la'o //
translated: Vam is for “bowing.”

original: 'di dag las aa ru'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las aa ru'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The ā is the ending of these.

original: sha r'a ru:/ band'a ru:/
analyzed: sha r'a ru:/ band'a ru:/
translated: Śarāru, bandāru.

original: bh'i las ru lug dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: bh'i las ru lug dag kyang ngo //
translated: The ru and luk are also from bhaya.

original: bh'i 'jigs pa la'o zhes pa 'di la las rug lug ces pa 'id dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bh'i 'jigs pa la'o zhes pa 'di la las rug lug ces pa 'id dag 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhaya is “fear.” Here the ru and luk are the endings.

original: bh'i r'u:/ bh'i lu:/
analyzed: bh'i r'u:/ bh'i lu:/
translated: Bhīru, bhīlu.

original: ru ka ka dang luk ka dag kyang 'dod do //
analyzed: ru ka ka dang luk ka dag kyang 'dod do //
translated: Ruka and lukha are also accepted.

original: bh'i ru ga:/ bh'i lu ka:/
analyzed: bh'i ru ga:/ bh'i lu ka:/
translated: Bhīruga, bhīluka.

original: bhra rdzi bri dhurbi aurdzi gra ba ru dhu ti bras rnams kyi'ang kvipa'o //
analyzed: bhra rdzi bri dhurbi aurdzi gra ba ru dhu ti bras rnams kyi'ang kvipa'o //
translated: The kvi is also of bhrāj, bhrīd, bhrūd, bhrūḍ, bhrūḍi, bhrūḍha, bhrūṣa.

original: bhri dza gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: bhri dza gsal ba la'o //
translated: Bhrāj is “shining.”

original: pri skyong ba la'o //
analyzed: pri skyong ba la'o //
translated: Bhrīd is “protecting.”

original: dhurba 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: dhurba 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Dhūrva means “harm.”

original: aurdzi stobs la'o //
analyzed: aurdzi stobs la'o //
translated: Ūrdhva means “strength.”

original: tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir ain mtha'o //
analyzed: tsur sogs nyid kyi phyir ain mtha'o //
translated: The final i is for the sake of the taddhita affix cur and so on.

original: shtu'i sngon du gra ba'o //
analyzed: shtu'i sngon du gra ba'o //
translated: The final a is for the sake of the affix śatu.

original: dhu ta 'bar ba la'o //🔽bha sri snang ba la'ang 'di rnams las kvi pa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhu ta 'bar ba la'o // bha sri snang ba la'ang 'di rnams las kvi pa pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Dhūta means “to blaze.”🔽Bhās means “to shine.”

original: bi bh'a ta /
analyzed: bi bh'a ta /
translated: Vibhāta means “to be divided.”

original: ha shasha tsha mtha' zhes pas da'o //🔽p'u:/ pu roo /
analyzed: ha shasha tsha mtha' zhes pas da'o // p'u:/ pu roo /
translated: Haśśa means “to be hot.”🔽Pū means “to be full.”

original: mchur gyur au pa dh'a'i zhes pas aura'o //
analyzed: mchur gyur au pa dh'a'i zhes pas aura'o //
translated: Ūpa means “to be near.”

original: ai ra aur dag gi a'ir a'ur dag go //
analyzed: ai ra aur dag gi a'ir a'ur dag go //
translated: Ira and ūra mean “to be swollen.”

original: dhu:/ dhu roo /
analyzed: dhu:/ dhu roo /
translated: Dhū means “to be heavy.”

original: ra las dbyi ba dag go zhes pas ba dbyi'o //🔽aurka / kvipa'o //
analyzed: ra las dbyi ba dag go zhes pas ba dbyi'o // aurka / kvipa'o //
translated: Ra means “to be light.”🔽Ūrka means “to be light.”

original: k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
translated: Kārita means “to be light.”

original: tsa sde dang dri sha zhes pa ga'o //🔽gra bstu ta /
analyzed: tsa sde dang dri sha zhes pa ga'o // gra bstu ta /
translated: Ca means “to be fragrant.”🔽Grā means “to praise.”

original: gra ba bstod do zhes kvi pa'o //
analyzed: gra ba bstod do zhes kvi pa'o //
translated: Grā means “to praise.”

original: byings kyi mtha' ta'o //
analyzed: byings kyi mtha' ta'o //
translated: The final ta is for the sake of the affix.

original: bi dhu ta /
analyzed: bi dhu ta /
translated: Vidhūta means “to be shaken.”

original: bha:/ de'i ngang tshul las sogs kyi don brjod par 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: bha:/ de'i ngang tshul las sogs kyi don brjod par 'dod pa la'o //
translated: Bhā means “to be of that nature” and so on.

original: drin gyis gnod par gyur ro zhes kvi pa'i rkyen grub kyang slar yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: drin gyis gnod par gyur ro zhes kvi pa'i rkyen grub kyang slar yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one says, He is harmed by kindness, the kvip is formed, but it must be stated again.

original: dhu ti gam dag gnyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dhu ti gam dag gnyis kyang ngo //
translated: Dhu and gam are also.

original: dhu ti dang ga mi dad pas kvi pa pha rol tu 'gyur zheng de dag gi gzugs kyang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhu ti dang ga mi dad pas kvi pa pha rol tu 'gyur zheng de dag gi gzugs kyang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the difference of dhu and gam, the kvip becomes the other, and their forms become two.

original: di dhu ta /
analyzed: di dhu ta /
translated: Dhu and t

original: dza gat / gal bar byed do 'gro bar byed do la kvi pa'o //
analyzed: dza gat / gal bar byed do 'gro bar byed do la kvi pa'o //
translated: He causes, he goes is kvip.

original: dhu ti sva pi dag gi aa bhya sa'i zhes pas dhu ti las sam pra a'a ra na'o //
analyzed: dhu ti sva pi dag gi aa bhya sa'i zhes pas dhu ti las sam pra a'a ra na'o //
translated: By dhu and svapi, the abhyasi is said. From dhu is pra-araṇa.

original: yam man tan gam rnams kyi kvi pa la'o zhes pas ga mi'i lnga pa dbyi'o ;🔽/ bi sha ma bra rnams la bha las du'o //
analyzed: yam man tan gam rnams kyi kvi pa la'o zhes pas ga mi'i lnga pa dbyi'o ; / bi sha ma bra rnams la bha las du'o //
translated: By yam, man, and gam, the kvip is said. The fifth of gam is the visarga.🔽By vi, śa, and pra, the bha becomes du.

original: bi dang sham dang pra zhes pa 'di rnams nyia'i tshig la bha ba ti las tu'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bi dang sham dang pra zhes pa 'di rnams nyia'i tshig la bha ba ti las tu'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: Vi, śa, and pra are words of the neuter. The bha becomes the du affix.

original: bi bhu:/ sha mabhu: pra bhu:/
analyzed: bi bhu:/ sha mabhu: pra bhu:/
translated: Vibhuḥ, śambhuḥ, prabhuḥ.

original: du'i rkyen no //
analyzed: du'i rkyen no //
translated: The du affix.

original: mtha' dbyangs sogs dbyi'o //
analyzed: mtha' dbyangs sogs dbyi'o //
translated: The visarga is at the end of the vowel, etc.

original: dhe ta las las la shta na'o //
analyzed: dhe ta las las la shta na'o //
translated: By dheti, the la becomes śaṭ.

original: dhet las las kyi don la shutran pha rol du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhet las las kyi don la shutran pha rol du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the root to drink (pib), the word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana.

original: na yig ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //🔽de 'thung bar byed do zhes dh'a t'i /🔽dhet 'thung ba la'o //🔽shtra na'o // sha yig a'i yig gi don to //
analyzed: na yig ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to // de 'thung bar byed do zhes dh'a t'i / dhet 'thung ba la'o // shtra na'o // sha yig a'i yig gi don to //
translated: The word various (nānā) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to go (gac) with the prefix na.🔽The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib).

original: sha nyid mi 'jug pa la ta nyid ldog ste /🔽aes mantra zhes ta yig brjod pa'i phyir ro //🔽shata rjes su 'brel pa zhes pas pa'i yig go //🔽n'i d'a dang sha su yu yu dzi stu tu da si si tsa mi ha ba ta dam shan ha rnams kyi @291b byed pa la'o //
analyzed: sha nyid mi 'jug pa la ta nyid ldog ste / aes mantra zhes ta yig brjod pa'i phyir ro // shata rjes su 'brel pa zhes pas pa'i yig go // n'i d'a dang sha su yu yu dzi stu tu da si si tsa mi ha ba ta dam shan ha rnams kyi @291b byed pa la'o //
translated: The word enemy (śatru) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.🔽The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.🔽The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.🔽The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.

original: ninya thob pa la'o //🔽dp'a gcod pa la'o //🔽shasu 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: ninya thob pa la'o // dp'a gcod pa la'o // shasu 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.

original: yu bsre ba la'o //🔽au dz'a ri sbyor ba la'o //🔽shtunya bstod pa la'o //🔽tud 'ther ba la'o //🔽shinya 'tshing ba la'o //
analyzed: yu bsre ba la'o // au dz'a ri sbyor ba la'o // shtunya bstod pa la'o // tud 'ther ba la'o // shinya 'tshing ba la'o //
translated: The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.🔽The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.

original: shi tsa 'dzag pa la'o //🔽mi ha sing ba la'o //🔽patli 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: shi tsa 'dzag pa la'o // mi ha sing ba la'o // patli 'gro ba la'o //
translated: The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.

original: dam sha za ba la'o //
analyzed: dam sha za ba la'o //
translated: The word to drink (pibana) is formed by adding the nominal suffix ana to the root to drink (pib) with the prefix śa.

original: naha 'ching ba la'o //
analyzed: naha 'ching ba la'o //
translated: Naha means “to bind.”

original: 'di rnams las byed pa'i don la shtan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las byed pa'i don la shtan pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, the verbal roots that have the meaning of “to do” are śat.

original: 'dis 'thob par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis 'thob par byed do //
translated: This one causes to obtain.

original: ne tram / 'dis gcod par byed do zhes /🔽d'a tram / 'dis 'tshe bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: ne tram / 'dis gcod par byed do zhes / d'a tram / 'dis 'tshe bar byed do zhes /
translated: Netraṃ means “this one causes to cut.”🔽Dātraṃ means “this one causes to harm.”

original: shastram / 'di bsre bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: shastram / 'di bsre bar byed do zhes /
translated: Śastraṃ means “this one causes to burn.”

original: aost'am / 'dis sbyor bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: aost'am / 'dis sbyor bar byed do zhes /
translated: Austaṃ means “this one causes to unite.”

original: yoktram / 'dis bstod par byed do zhes ;
analyzed: yoktram / 'dis bstod par byed do zhes ;
translated: Yoktraṃ means “this one causes to praise.”

original: sto tram / 'dis 'thor byar byed do //🔽tottram / 'dis sing bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: sto tram / 'dis 'thor byar byed do // tottram / 'dis sing bar byed do zhes /
translated: Stotraṃ means “this one causes to scatter.”🔽Tottraṃ means “this one causes to be noisy.”

original: se tram / 'dis 'dzag par byed do zhes /
analyzed: se tram / 'dis 'dzag par byed do zhes /
translated: Setraṃ means “this one causes to drip.”

original: sektram / 'dis dran par byed do zhes /
analyzed: sektram / 'dis dran par byed do zhes /
translated: Sektraṃ means “this one causes to remember.”

original: me dha / ha'i dha'o //
analyzed: me dha / ha'i dha'o //
translated: Medha means “to go.”

original: gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
analyzed: gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
translated: From gha, dha, da, bha, and so on, it is ṭha.

original: dha las dh'i dbyi'o //
analyzed: dha las dh'i dbyi'o //
translated: From dha, it is ḍha.

original: 'dis 'gro bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bar byed do zhes /
translated: This one causes to go.

original: battra / aa ma yin pa las zhes pas ait a'a ga ma med de //
analyzed: battra / aa ma yin pa las zhes pas ait a'a ga ma med de //
translated: Battraṃ means “not to be.” From a, it is ita. There is no āga.

original: shnu dam ga ae yig byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shnu dam ga ae yig byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of the letter e.

original: 'dir za bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: 'dir za bar byed do zhes /
translated: Here, it is “to eat.”

original: damshtra / tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //🔽'dis 'ching bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: damshtra / tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o // 'dis 'ching bar byed do zhes /
translated: The a is also from the da and sa.

original: ni hi'i dha'o //
analyzed: ni hi'i dha'o //
translated: It binds, therefore ni-hi-dha.

original: gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas dha'o //
analyzed: gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas dha'o //
translated: The dha is from the gha, da, dha, bha.

original: dhuta rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas da'o //
analyzed: dhuta rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas da'o //
translated: The da is the third of the dhus.

original: sha da rjes su 'brel pa las a'i'o //
analyzed: sha da rjes su 'brel pa las a'i'o //
translated: The i is from the sa and the suffix.

original: s'u las thong pa dang phag dag la'o //
analyzed: s'u las thong pa dang phag dag la'o //
translated: The su is for the plough and the pig.

original: thong pa phag dag gi zhes drug pa'o //
analyzed: thong pa phag dag gi zhes drug pa'o //
translated: The su is the sixth, for the plough and the pig.

original: su zhes pa 'dis pung dang punya gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: su zhes pa 'dis pung dang punya gzung bar bya'o //
translated: By this su the words puṅgala and puṇya are to be taken.

original: pung las byed pa po'i don la shtra na pha rol tu 'gyur te /🔽de gal te phag dang thong pa dag dang 'brel pa'i byed pa /
analyzed: pung las byed pa po'i don la shtra na pha rol tu 'gyur te / de gal te phag dang thong pa dag dang 'brel pa'i byed pa /
translated: From puṅgala the meaning of the agent becomes the opponent, śatṛ.

original: ha la sya so tram /
analyzed: ha la sya so tram /
translated: If that is connected with the plough and the pig, the agent is halasya sotraṃ.

original: s'a ka ra sya potram ;
analyzed: s'a ka ra sya potram ;
translated: The son of Sakara is potraṃ.

original: gdong pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gdong pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is face.

original: 'dis 'thung bar byed do zhes shtrana'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'thung bar byed do zhes shtrana'o //
translated: It drinks, therefore śatrinā.

original: aarti l'u dh'u s'u ka ni sa hi tsa ri rnams las ai trana'o //
analyzed: aarti l'u dh'u s'u ka ni sa hi tsa ri rnams las ai trana'o //
translated: The iṇ is from the artilūdhāsu kṛti.

original: ri 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: ri 'gro ba la'o //
translated: The ri is for going.

original: l'unya gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: l'unya gcod pa la'o //
translated: The lūnya is for cutting.

original: dhu rnam par bskyod pa la'o //
analyzed: dhu rnam par bskyod pa la'o //
translated: Dhū is for “to shake.”

original: shu ded pa la'o //
analyzed: shu ded pa la'o //
translated: Śū is for “to lead.”

original: sa bi tram /

original: kha ni tram /

analyzed: rtsa ku sha'i rnam 'gyur brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: dag par byed do zhes //

analyzed: lha la dag par zhes //

original: sa bi tram tu tra:/
analyzed: sa bi tram tu tra:/

original: nyi rjes su 'brel pa dang 'dod pa blo mchod pa'i don rnams las kyang kta'o //
analyzed: nyi rjes su 'brel pa dang 'dod pa blo mchod pa'i don rnams las kyang kta'o //

original: gang rnams nyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni nyi rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams nyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni nyi rjes su 'brel pa'o //

original: 'dod pa dang blo dang mchod pa nyid ni gang rnams kyi 'dod pa blo mchod pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang blo dang mchod pa nyid ni gang rnams kyi 'dod pa blo mchod pa'i don to //

original: de nas zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye'o //

original: nyi rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang 'dod pa'i don rnams dang blo'i don rnams dang mchod pa'i don rnams dang mchod pa'i don rnams las kyang da ltar ba'i dus la kta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang 'dod pa'i don rnams dang blo'i don rnams dang mchod pa'i don rnams dang mchod pa'i don rnams las kyang da ltar ba'i dus la kta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: zhes par byed do zhes kta'o //

analyzed: a'i au pa dh'a ring po'o // 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bha b'i /
